loans.name: Francine

texts.en: Francine is 42 years old. She is a widow with four children. She sells foodstuffs and has been in the business for four years. With the loan, she wants to buy more sweet potatoes and bananas for sale. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the same business for the better future of the business.

loans.use: To buy more sweet potatoes and bananas for sale.

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Annah, a resident of Mombasa, runs a cafe which she has been operating for the last ten years. She is a married mother of three children. Besides this, the family also runs a clothing shop in the area.

Annah was introduced to Milango Financial Services by her friends. She joined to access credit and is applying for a loan of KES 96,550 (Kenya shillings) to buy food stocks for the cafe business, like rice, cereals, and beverages. Despite the challenge of low customer turn out, she believes this will help provide for her family's needs and improve the standard of living.

loans.use: to buy food stocks for her cafe business, like rice, cereals, and beverages.

loans.name: Jeannette

texts.en: Jeannette sells sorghum and has been doing so for 15 years. She is married with four children, and three of them go to school. With the loan, she wants the loan to buy more sorghum for sale. The profits from the business will be used to expand the business.

loans.use: To buy more sorghum for sale.

loans.name: Karina Paola

texts.es: Con su anterior credikiva, Karina logró comprar equipos de trabajo coo secadores planchas un labacabezas etc. Ahora está mucho mas cómoda trabajando, sus clientes mejor atendidos y las ofertas en su negocio no se hacen esperar, aumentando sus utilidades. En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo financiamiento con el cual comprará productos capilares y de belleza para consumir en su negocio y para la venta con ello generará mucho mas ingresos y la rotación del servicio aumentará y esto es justamente el éxito de su credikiva.
texts.en:
With her previous Kiva loan, Karina was able to buy equipment such as hair-dryers, hair straighteners, hair-wash chairs etc. Now she is much more comfortable working, her clients are better looked after, and the offers in her business take immediate effect, increasing her income.

At present, she is applying for a new loan with which she will buy hair care and beauty products for consumption in her business, as well as to sell. This will increase her income substantially and the turnover of the business will increase, and this is precisely the success of her Kiva loan.

loans.use: to buy hair care and beauty products.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.es:
Nilda, de 59 años de edad,esta casada y tiene 06 hijos; 04 de ellos ya son mayores y solo 02 viven bajo su cuidado. Tiene su casa propia la cual pudo comprar junto a su esposo .El trabajo de Nilda consiste en la venta de productos comestibles por está razón compra los productos en grandes cantidades y de ahí se encarga de venderlos en su hogar ,entre los productos que ofrece tiene arroz, azúcar, huevos, aceite, enlatados, condimentos y otros. Lleva en este negocio un promedio de 15 años y gracias a esta actividad pudo educar a sus hijos e implementar su casa con algunos artefactos, por lo general trabaja sola y en algunas ocasiones recibe la ayuda de su hija mientras su esposo trabaja fuera de casa. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que tiene tiempo para realizar otras actividades dentro de su hogar, le está yendo muy bien ya que siempre tiene clientes que atender aunque por ahora prefiere mantenerse con lo que viene comprando pero más adelante espera implementarlo y realizar algunos cambios en la infraestructura de su local de atención.Este es el préstamo número 06 con Kiva y agradece a quienes le brindan el préstamo que requiere para seguir aumentando su negocio.
Con el monto solicitado de S/.500 soles, comprará mayor cantidad de productos comestibles como arroz, pan, azúcar, huevos, verduras entre otros, además mejorará la infraestructura de su tienda con la compra de madera y clavos.
texts.en:
Nilda is 59 years old, married, and has six children. Four of them have already grown up and only two of them are still dependent on her. She has her own home, which she bought with her husband. Nilda works selling foodstuffs, buying large amounts of products and then selling them in her home. The items that she sells include rice, sugar, eggs, oil, canned goods, condiments and others. 

She has had this business for around fifteen years and thanks to this, she has been able to educate her children and buy certain items for her home. In general, she works alone, but her daughter sometimes helps her out while her husband goes out to work. What she likes about her work is that she has time to do other activities in her home. The business is doing very well as she always has customers to serve, and for the moment, she is content to support herself with this. However, in the future she hopes to sell more and make some changes to the infrastructure of her store. 

This is her sixth loan with Kiva and she is grateful to those who help with the loan she needs to continue growing her business. With the amount requested, she will buy more foodstuffs such as rice, bread, eggs, and vegetables. In addition, she will buy wood and nails to improve her store's infrastructure.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs such as rice, bread, and sugar.

loans.name: Gawu

texts.en:
Gawu is 29 years old and is married with six children between the ages of 11 months and 14 years. She lives in Kakata, the capital city of Margibi County, which has the highest number of rubber plantations in Liberia. For the past ten years, Gawu has been selling rice, oil, and charcoal in the local market. She started her business with money given to her by her sister and she learned her trade from friends. Gawu works nine hours each day.

Gawu is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, oil, and charcoal for her business. In the future, she hopes to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase rice, oil, and charcoal for her business

loans.name: Bessa Group

texts.en:
This group consists of Alex, Mary, and Emilia.  They sell books, wax print, and vegetables in the community, respectively.  They reside in the Dansoman community and have been together since 2010.  They are still doing very well. 

Mary is a 36-year-old who has been selling cloths for 12 years.  She has been with ID Ghana for the past 2 years and is doing very well.  She sells from Mondays to Saturdays.  This is her 4th loan and she needs an amount of 1,400 GHS to buy more cloths to sell to her customers.  She is grateful to ID Ghana. 

The entire group needs a total amount of 2,400 GHS to buy more items to sell to their customers in the Dansoman community.

loans.use: to buy more wax-print cloths to sell.

loans.name: Fenda

texts.en:
Fenda is 49 years old and lives in Kakata, the capital of Margibi County.  This area has the highest rubber production plantation in Liberia.  Fenda is married with 6 children between the ages of 10 and 29 years old.  Only 4 live at home and attend school.
  
For the past eight years she has been selling charcoal in the local market.  She started this business and learned this trade from her friends.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal for her business. She hopes to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Haykanush

texts.en:
Haykanush is from the Syunik region and works at a local kindergarten school. Haykanush is married with three children, two daughters and a son. Her elder daughter, Lida, studies at Yerevan State University in the department of international relations.

Haykanush and her husband work hard to sustain their family and cover their children's basic costs. However, it is very difficult for them to save money for Lida's education.

Haykanush has applied for this loan to pay for Lida's university tuition. The loan is very important for Haykanush and her family to give Lida an opportunity to complete her education and become a good specialist.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's university tuition.

loans.name: Jesús María

texts.es:
Jesús de 54 años de edad, tiene claro que para salir adelante, y ofrecerle mejores condiciones de vida a  su familia, el trabajo es su principal pasaporte a un mejor futuro. Razón por la cual labora diariamente a fin de generar los ingresos suficientes para garantizarles a su esposa y sus dos hijas una mejor calidad de vida.
Desde hace diez años se dedica a la producción y comercialización de huevos de codorniz, producto bastante apreciado en su localidad.
Su mayor deseo es poder industrializar su producto para generar mejores utilidades y distribuirlo no sólo en el mercado local si no en toda la región del departamento de Antioquia, Colombia. Hoy se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de más aves ya que sus clientes han aumentado sus pedidos y debe mantener un stock que le permita cumplir con el índice de demanda. Espera poder brindarles a sus dos hijas la oportunidad de acceder a al educación superior y contar con un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Jesús is 54 years old, and he knows that to get ahead and offer his family better living conditions, work is the main passport to a better future. This is why he works every day in order to generate enough income to guarantee his wife and two daughters a better quality of life. For 10 years he has worked in the production and commercialisation of quail eggs, a product which is highly prized in his area.

His biggest wish is to be able to industrialise his production to generate better profits and to distribute it not only in the local market but in the entire region of the Antioquia department in Colombia. He is currently asking for a loan which he will invest in the purchase of more birds since his clients have increased their orders and he has to keep a stock that will allow him to fulfil the demand. He hopes to be able to offer his two daughters the opportunity to go through higher education and have a better future.

loans.use: to buy quails.

loans.name: Heydi

texts.es: Heidy de 36 años de edad vive en el municipio de Soledad lugar donde tiene una tienda de productos de belleza y vende además herramientas y equipos profesionales. Los principales productos son tintes, champo, enjuagues, lociones, e implementos y maquinarias que utilizan en salones de belleza y escuelas o centros educativos de enseñanza, de técnicas de mejoramiento de la imagen personal y profesional. Su mayor propósito es lograr un crecimiento armónico y ser reconocido por la calidad de los productos que ofrece en su tienda. Su máximo desafío es lograr captar una clientela que compre en mayor volumen y tener un capital de trabajo suficiente, para responder a una potencial y creciente demanda. En la actualidad está acudiendo a un credikiva, segundo financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará productos de belleza en mayor volumen, para ganar descuentos y tener un inventario que impacte a su clientela,como lo ha hecho poco a poco con los financiamientos; ella se propone  alcanzar un mayor volumen en sus ventas, para genera nuevos ingresos que beneficien su bienestar y el de su familia.
texts.en:
Heidy is 36 years old and lives in the town of Soledad, where she has a store selling beauty products and professional tools and equipment. The main products are hair dye, shampoo, conditioner, lotions, and equipment and machines that are used in beauty salons and beauty schools and centers teaching techniques to improve people's personal and professional image. 

Her biggest goal is to grow harmoniously and gain recognition for the quality of the products she offers in her store. Her biggest challenge is to attract customers who buy in large volumes and secure enough working capital to meet the potential and growing demand.

Today, Heidy is requesting a loan from Kiva, her second loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which she can buy beauty products in bulk to get discounts and build up an inventory for her customers. She has managed this little by little with her previous loan. She wants to increase her sales to make higher profits which benefit her and her family's wellbeing.

loans.use: to buy beauty products in bulk.

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
Olga, de 31 años de edad, está casada y tiene un hijo de 06 años quien es su razón de vivir y por quien trabaja día a día para brindarle una mejor calidad de vida. Vive junto a su esposo y su hijo en la casa de sus suegros quienes le ayudan con el cuidado de su niño.El trabajo de Olga consiste en la reparación de electrodomésticos de línea blanca, además de vender repuestos de los mismos, trabaja junto a su esposo, antes se dedicaba a otras labores y su pareja trabajaba como soporte en una tienda de artefactos de electrodomésticos lo cual le sirvió para conocer futuros clientes, pero es independiente y desde hace 02 años emprendieron este negocio solos y son muy solicitados. Actualmente arreglan lavadoras, hornos microondas, ollas arroceras y otros. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que tiene tiempo disponible para trabajar tranquilamente sin descuidar a su hijo y eso es muy satisfactorio.Este es el préstamo número 04 con Kiva, es por ello que agradece a todas las personas que le brindan la oportunidad de acceder a un apoyo financiero para que pueda concretar sus planes.
Con el monto solicitado de S/.1500 soles, comprará repuestos para lavadoras además comprará algunas herramientas para desarrollar mejor su servicio de reparación de electrodomésticos.
texts.en:
Olga, age 31, is married and has a 6-year-old son who is her reason for living; she works day after day to provide him with a better quality of life. She lives together with her husband and her son in the house of her in-laws, who help her take care of her child. Olga's work is repairing domestic appliances, and she also sells spare parts for them. She works together with her husband. Earlier, she dedicated herself to other work, and her husband was a support technician in an appliance store. This helped him get to know future customers, but now he is independent, and for the past two years they have been running this business alone, and they are very sought-after. Currently, they repair washing machines, microwave ovens, rice cookers and other appliances. What she likes about her work is that she has the time available to work calmly, without neglecting her son, and this gives her a lot of satisfaction. This is loan number 4 for her with Kiva, and she is grateful to all of the people who are providing her with this opportunity to obtain financial support so that she can carry out her plans. 

With the requested amount of 1500 soles, she will buy spare parts for washing machines, and she will also buy some tools so that she can provide her appliance repair service more effectively.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for washing machines and repair tools.

loans.name: Yassah

texts.en:
Yassah lives in Kakata Town, the capital City of Margibi County.  This area has the highest producing rubber plantation in Liberia.

Yassah is 21 years old and single.  She has a 5-year-old child who lives at home and attends school.  Yassah did not go to school.  For the past 4 years she has been selling palm oil in the local market.  She started this business with the help of her boyfriend and learned how to sell from her friends.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more palm oil for her business.

She enjoys her business and the profit she receives, which she hopes to use one day to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil for her business.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 32 years old and single. She lives in Kakata, the capital city of Margibi County, which is the highest-producing rubber plantation in Liberia. She has four children between 7 months to 12 years old. Only three of her children are in school and all four of them live at home. Sarah was unable to attend school herself.

For the past two years, Sarah has been selling rice, pepper, oil, salt, onions, etc. from a table in the market. She focuses on food items because the demand for cooked food items in Liberia is very high. She established her business with a loan from her mother. She enjoys the independence her income gives her. 

Sarah is requesting a loan to buy more rice, pepper, oil, salt, onions, etc. for her business. Her plans for the future are to build a shop and a house for her children.

loans.use: to buy more rice, pepper, oil, salt, onions, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Mwongeli

texts.en:
Mwongeli is married and has two children, one of whom goes to school. She rents a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest challenge is paying for food and rent. She runs a retail kiosk where she sells vegetables and charcoal.

Mwongeli is kindly asking for a loan of KES 25,000 to buy various kinds of vegetables and six bags of charcoal for sale to her clients.

loans.use: to buy various kinds of vegetables and six bags of charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Victoire

texts.en: Victoire is 27 years old. She is married with two children. For the past three years, she has sold foodstuffs. She is requesting a loan to buy more beans and sorghum for sale. The profits from the business will be used to build a house.

loans.use: To buy more beans and sorghum for sale.

loans.name: Mareselo

texts.en:
Mareselo is a 46-year-old businessman who lives in Juba. He is married with three children between the ages 3 and 9 years. All of them go to school. 

Mareselo runs a general store and has been in business for six years. He has no employees. He heard about Finance Sudan Limited through promotions by the loan officers. He is taking a loan of SSP 4,000 to purchase more maize, flour, and many other items. In addition to this business, he has no other source of income.

In five years, Mareselo would like to expand his business and open other branches. His major challenges include high market prices and high transportation costs. Mareselo says he is happy for the loans given by Finance Sudan Limited, through the help of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more items for his store, like maize and flour.

loans.name: Maryana

texts.ru:
У Марьяны – 2 теплицы площадью в 15 соток. Она занимается разведением цветов, выращивает их в горшках на продажу. Наемных рабочих у Марьяны нет – все делает сама, семья тоже помогает в бизнесе. Марьяна занимается этим бизнесом уже 6 лет. В свободное время очень любит проводить время с семьей на природе.  
Марьяна хочет закупить семян, пленку, удобрения и дрова на сумму 15 000 гривен. Со временем она планирует построить дома еще одну дополнительную теплицу для расширения бизнеса.
texts.en:
Maryana has two greenhouses for the total space of 1500 square meters [about 0.4 acres]. She grows flowers in pots for sale. She does not employ any workers—she does everything herself, with her family’s help. Maryana has been in this business for six years. In her spare time she enjoys spending time outdoors with her family.

Maryana would like to buy seeds, film, fertilizers and firewood for the amount of 15,000 UAH. In the future, she plans to build an additional greenhouse by her house in order to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy seeds, film, fertilizers and firewood.

loans.name: Immaculee

texts.en: Immaculee is 31 years old. For the past three years, she has sold phones and accessories. With the loan, she will buy more phones and accessories for sale. Immaculee plans to use the profits she earns to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To buy more phones and accessories for sale.

loans.name: Nyanpu

texts.en:
Nyanpu is 46 years old and lives in the area of Kakata Town, the capital city of Margibi County which has the highest producing rubber plantation in Liberia. She is married with six children who are in school. With the little income from her husband, who is a businessman, she opened a shop where she sells red oil, cassava, etc. She has been in this business for 10 years now, and she enjoys the flow of her customers.
She is requesting a loan to purchase more red oil, cassava, etc. to resell to enable her to build a better shop for her business. Her dream is to become a house owner in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more red oil, cassava, etc. to resell.

loans.name: Koo Group

texts.en:
This group consists of two partners residing in Dansoman. They are Frank and Kwaku who have been together since 2011 and are still doing very well. They are a tailor and a barber respectively.

Frank, the leader, is 37 years old. He has been a tailor for the past 18 years. On the 15th of March, 2011, he took his first loan of GHS 300. Through his dedication and seriousness in his business, he has been able to build up trust with ID Ghana. 

On his fourth loan, he is requesting an amount of GHS 1,200 to help him to buy sewing materials and sell products to boost the business and to satisfy his customers in and around the community.

The two members together need GHS 2,200 to buy more goods to sell to their respective customers in the community.

loans.use: To buy more sewing materials and sell products to customers

loans.name: Xaverine

texts.en: Xaverine, 54, is married with six children who all go to school. She sells sorghum and has been in the business for three years. With the loan, she wants to buy more sorghum for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more sorghum for sale.

loans.name: Sandrine

texts.en: Sandrine is 22 years old. She is married and has one child who is one year old. She sells foodstuffs and has been in the business for two years. With the loan, she wants to add more beans and sorghum for sale. The profits from the business will be used to buy goats.

loans.use: To buy more beans and sorghum for sale.

loans.name: Jeannette

texts.en: Jeannette is 28 years old. She is married with four children; only two go to school. She sells peanuts and has been doing this business for four years. With the loan, she wants to buy more peanuts for sale. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the business.

loans.use: To buy more peanuts for sale.

loans.name: Aidee

texts.es:
Aidee, de 50 años, está casada y tiene 04 hijos que ya son mayores, de los cuales solo 2 de ellos viven asu lado en la casa propia que compro hace muchos años atras. Aidee posee una tienda de comestibles ,negocio al que se dedica en tiempo completo . Abastece su negocio de manera semanal comprando en los centros comerciales del centro de la ciudad y lleva realizando su trabajo desde hace 05 años.
Le esta yendo bien ya que tiene buenos ingresos por eso espera poder ampliar su negocio y empezar a ahorrar para invertir en la construcción de su vivienda .Este es el préstamo número 05 con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe ya que le permite ampliar su negocio .Con el monto solicitado de S/.100O soles comprará productos comestibles tales como arroz , leche , azucar , condimentos , entre otros .
texts.en:
Aidee, age 50, is married and has 4 children who are already grown. Only two of them live by her side in her own house which she bought many years ago. Aidee has a grocery store, and she works in this business full-time. She stocks her store weekly, buying at the shopping centers downtown. She has been doing this work for five years. 

It is going well for her, since she has a good income, and thus she hopes to be able to expand her business and save up to invest in construction work at her home. This is loan number 5 for her with Kiva, and she feels grateful for the financial support she is receiving, since it allows her to expand her business. With the requested amount of 1000 soles, she will buy grocery products such as rice, milk, sugar, condiments, and other items.

loans.use: To buy grocery products such as rice, sugar, milk and others.

loans.name: Emile

texts.en: Emile is 31 years old and the father of three children, ages 2 to 7. Only one goes to school. He wants the loan to upgrade his business, adding more items like sugar, rice, salt and lotions for sale. The profits from the business will be used to buy a cow  to provide milk for the entire family.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, rice, salt and lotions for sale.

loans.name: Mejja

texts.en:
Mejja is a 40-year-old businesswoman who lives in Juba. She is married and has five children between the ages of 5 and 18.  All of them go to school.
Mejja runs a general store and has been in business for six years. She has no employees. She heard about Finance Sudan through other clients. She is taking a loan of 3000 SSP to purchase water, soda, and many other items to sell. She has no other source of income.
In five years, Mejja would like to expand her business. Her major challenges include high prices in the market. Mejja says she is happy for the loans given by finance Sudan through the help of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more water, soda, etc.

loans.name: Abi Grfforoup Group

texts.en:
Abigail and Susana are the members in this group. They are a hairdresser and a seamstress respectively. They reside at Bortianor in the Dansoman community. They have been together since 2012. 

Abigail is a 28-year-old hairdresser who is married to Joseph, a 35-year-old barber. They are blessed with a child. She has been with ID Ghana for the past year and is doing very well with her business. 

She has been in business for three years now. She works from Mondays through Saturdays. Without ID Ghana’s training on savings, she would not have made it this far. 

This is her third loan and she needs GHS 1,000 to buy more hair care goods to sell to her customers. 
 
Both need a total amount of GHS 1,300 to buy more goods to sell to their customers in the community.

loans.use: To buy more hair care goods to sell to her customers

loans.name: Lilit

texts.en:
Lilit is from Yerevan. She studies at the European Regional Educational Academy in Yerevan. Lilit applied to us in the past for a loan to pay for her first semester's university tuition. Her parents work hard to sustain the family and it is very difficult for them to pay for Lilit's education. Lilit wants to find a job and earn her own income, but unfortunately it is very difficult for her to find a job without working experience.

Now she has applied for this loan to pay for her second semester of university tuition.

The loan is very important for Lilit to be able to complete her education and get a diploma.

loans.use: to pay for her second semester of university tuition.

loans.name: Alphonsine

texts.en: Alphonsine is 39 years old. She sells beans, maize and sorghum. She is married with one child, and her husband works as a farmer. With the loan, she wants to add more beans and maize flour for sale. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the same business.

loans.use: To buy more beans and maize flour for sale.

loans.name: Vilginie

texts.en: Vilginie is 35 years old. She sells sorghum and has been in the business for one year. With the loan, she wants to buy more sorghum for sale. The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house.

loans.use: To buy more sorghum for sale.

loans.name: Josiane

texts.en: Josiane is 22 years old. She is married to a farmer and has two children, neither of whom go to school. With the loan, she wants to buy more beans, flour and sorghum for sale. The profits from the business will be reinvested in the business.

loans.use: To buy more beans, flour and sorghum for sale.

loans.name: Elshan

texts.en:
Elshan is 29 years old, married and has a child, a 4-year-old daughter. His daughter goes to preschool. He wants his daughter to become a biologist. His wife stays at home, so he is the only one making an income. 

Elshan has been an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from Fuzuli city. Now he lives in the Fuzuli region, which is close to the occupied border. 

This is Elshan's first loan from Kiva. He started his new business 10 months ago to sell home goods for the kitchen. Now he needs a 2,000 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat) loan to buy to buy utensils, dishes, cups, etc. 

Elshan wants to use the money from his new business to help his family. In the future, he wants to have his own store, not renting a store as he is now. This will be more profitable for his business. Elshan is thankful to Komak and Kiva for supporting him.

loans.use: to buy utensils, dishes, cups, etc.

loans.name: Dilbara

texts.ru: Дилбаре 47 лет, замужем, воспитывает 2 детей. C 1994 года Дилбара начала заниматься полеводством и животноводством с 10,000 KGS. На сегодняшний день Дилбара имеет 2 коровы, 30 овец и 2 лошади. Дилбара ежегодно обрабатывает 1,64 га земли га сажает фасоль и многолетние травы. Благодаря упорному труду и настойчивости Дилбар, ежемесячная прибыль от бизнеса составляет около 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Дилбар обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков и лошадей для улучшения породы. Доходы от кредита Дилбар планирует вкладывать в развитие бизнеса. Мечтает построить большой дом.
texts.en: Dilbara is 47 years old, married, and has 2 children. In 1994, she began raising cattle and growing crops with start-up capital of only 10,000 Kyrgyzstan Som. Today, she has 2 cows, 30 sheep, and 2 horses. Each year she works a 1.64-hectare plot of land where she plants beans and perennial herbs. Thanks to her hard work, her farm brings in monthly earnings of about 15,000 Som. For the purpose of further developing her business, Dilbara has approached Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 120,000 Som to purchase bulls and horses for breeding to improve the stock. She plans to use the income generated by this loan to reinvest in her business. Her dream is to build a large house.

loans.use: To purchase bulls and cows

loans.name: Fortunee

texts.en: Fortunee is 24 years old. She is married and has one child, aged 1. She has sold spare parts for bicycles for the past four years. With the loan, she wants to add more bicycle spare parts for sale. The profits from the business will be used to buy a cow for providing milk for the family.

loans.use: To buy more bicycle spare parts for sale.

loans.name: Gulmira

texts.ru: Гулмире 47 лет. Гулмира после распада Союза начала заниматься животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы в 10,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Гулмиры, ее хозяйство на сегодняшний день насчитывает 1 корову и 25 голов овец и приносит около 10,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Гулмира обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительных голов скота на откорм и перепродажу. Доходы от кредита Гулмира планирует вложить в ремонт дома и дальнейшее развитие своего хозяйства.
texts.en: Gulmira is 47 years old. After the fall of the Soviet Union, she began raising cattle, starting her business with just 10,000 Kyrgyzstan Som (KGS.) Thanks to her hard work, today her farm includes 1 cow and 25 sheep, and brings in monthly earnings of approximately 10,000 Som. For the purpose of further developing her business, Gulmira has approached Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 80,000 Som to purchase more cattle to fatten and sell. She plans to use the income generated by this loan to renovate her house, and for the continued development of her farm.

loans.use: To purchase more cattle

loans.name: Narine

texts.en:
Narine is from Yerevan. She studies at Russian-Armenian (Slavonic) University in the economics department. 

Narine lives with her parents, grandmother, sister and brother. Her father is a taxi driver; his income is barely enough to cover the family's daily expenses. Narine works at a local company as a designer and does her best to help her parents to sustain the family. Unfortunately it is very difficult for her to save money for her education. She has applied for this loan to pay for her university tuition. This loan is very important for Narine to complete her education and become a good economist.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition

loans.name: Akaki

texts.en:
Akaki is 35 years old. He lives in Gori District with his wife, Manana, and two children, who are going to school. Akaki requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time because of his low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of income for the family is Akaki’s small monthly salary. He is working in a bread bakery as a baker.

Akaki requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. His loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high-risk borrowers” because of low income. 

With the received credit, Akaki wants to open his own bread bakery. He will rent a place and purchase all the needed equipment. As he is already working in this business and has great experience, Akaki hopes it will be profitable. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase all the needed equipment for opening a bread bakery.

loans.name: Leoncie

texts.en: Leoncie is 30 years old. She is married with four children. She sells foodstuffs and has been doing business for three years. With the loan, she wants to add more beans and cooking oil for sale. With the profits from the business, she is planning to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To buy more beans and cooking oil for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies and ingredients.

loans.name: Belmira

texts.es:
Belmira, de 57 años de edad ,está casada y tiene 04 hijos mayores de edad, con quienes vive en su casa propia.Belmira se dedica a la venta de pescados por está razón todos los días se levanta muy temprano para dirigirse al puerto pesquero de la ciudad para comprar los mejores pescados, frescos y de buen tamaño. Cuando tiene todos los pescados, los selecciona por especie y por tamaño, de esta manera determina un precio justo y los va acondicionando en una mesa que tiene instalado en su puesto de mercado. Lleva en esta actividad más de 40 años y es su única fuente de ingresos económicos, trabaja siempre sola, lo hace durante toda la mañana.
Afirma que algunas veces ha sentido ganas de dejar todo atrás debido al intenso sol que la sofoca durante las mañanas, sin embargo, sabe que tiene que trabajar para cubrir sus necesidades, ahora ha considerado la posibilidad de vender plátanos por que asegura que es el mejor complemento alimenticio para el pescado y además porque sus propios clientes le solicitan tal producto, para ello solo necesita contar con el capital necesario y poner manos a la obra.Este es su crédito número 05 con Kiva, está muy contenta por el gran apoyo que le están brindando ya que siente que de esa forma su progreso familiar, económico y personal puede emerger de manera segura.Con el monto solicitado de S/. 2000 comprará pescados y varios racimos de plátano los cuales vendera de manera diaria para asi brindar lo necesario a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Belmira, who is 57 years old, is married and has 4 adult children with whom she lives in her own home.  Belmira makes her living selling fish.  For this reason, she gets up very early every day to go to the city's fishing port in order to buy the best fish, that are fresh and of good size.  Once she has all of her fish, she sorts them by species and size, so she can determine a fair price for them.  She then arranges them on a table that she has installed in her place in the market.  

Belmira has worked in this business for more than 40 years and it is her only source of income.  She always works alone and works all morning.  She admits that sometimes she has felt the urge to leave it all behind because of the intense sun that can be stifling in the mornings, but she knows she needs to work in order to support herself.  Now she is considering the possibility of selling plantains because they are the best dietary complement to fish and her customers are asking for them.  For this she only needs to obtain the necessary funds and get to work.  

This is Belmira's 5th loan with Kiva, and she is very happy with the great support each loan offers.  She feels that they allow her family, economic and personal progress to emerge in a secure manner.  With this loan of 2000 Peruvian Nuevos Soles, she will buy fish and many bunches of plantains that she will then sell daily in order to meet her customer's needs.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish and plantains.

loans.name: Firdovsi

texts.en:
Firdovsi has been an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from Fuzuli city. Now he lives in the Fuzuli region, which is close to the occupied border. He is 53 years old, married and has three children, a 19-year-old and a 23-year-old daughter and a 17-year-old son. His younger daughter goes to college, but his 23-year-old daughter is engaged. He wants his daughter to become a teacher, and his son to become an engineer. His wife stays at home, so he is the only one making an income. 

Firdovsi started his business eight years ago to raise cattle and to sell milk. Now he needs a 2,000 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat) loan to buy calves to increase the amount of dairy products to sell at local bazaars. He wants to use the money from his new business to help his family, and to have weddings for his daughters. 

In the future, Firdovsi wants to have a big farm for calves. This will be more profitable for his business. Firdovsi is thankful to Komak and Kiva for supporting him again.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en: Eva is a single mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She does not take care of additional family members. She has a business selling local brew and gin. She has applied for a loan of 100,000 UGX to buy more bags of millet and cassava flour for making local brew. She generates additional income by running a beauty salon. She has been in business for nine years and sells to all types of people. She sells on a retail basis seven days out of every week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. She aspires to own a fully stocked bar selling all types of drinks, and also to build her own house. She resides in a rented house. The family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bags of millet and cassava flour for making local brew.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.en:
Edgar studies at State Engineering University of Armenia in the department of computer systems and informatics. He lives with his parents. His father runs a little shop where he sells food products. This is the main source of income for this family; it is very difficult for them to save money for Edgar's education.

Edgar has applied for this loan to pay for his university tuition. This is very important for Edgar to complete his education and become a good specialist. As the IT sector is one of the most demanded sectors in Armenia, Edgar wants to find a job and help his parents to sustain the family.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy concrete blocks, cement and other building materials.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is an artisan from Ghana who specializes in designing hand-carved African masks. He would like to invest in the purchase of wood, aluminum plates, and sandpaper in order to continue production.

Robert has been selling through NOVICA since 2000. This is his story:

"I left my brother's workshop to start on my own. Presently, I work along with expert artists, all designers and carvers. I focus on mask design and we work with local Ghanaian woods. I love my art and I hope to produce more interesting designs for my customers."

"It is wonderful to have people like you, supporting artisans you do not know, so we can grow our business and provide for our families. I am very grateful to you all for this microcredit."

Use the link below to view Robert's hand-carved wood masks on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/2538

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of wood, aluminum plates, and sandpaper in order to continue production of his carvings.

loans.name: Doris

texts.es:
Doris, de 54 años de edad, es viuda y tiene 06 hijos, actualmente tiene a su cargo solo a 03 de ellos los cuales tienen 22, 19 y 16 años respectivamente, junto a ellos vive en su casa propia , el cual construyó con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación.El trabajo de Doris consiste en la elaboración de carbón. Alquila un espacio de un terreno alejado de la ciudad cuyos espacios han sido cedidos para cumplir esta función y desde ahí trabaja diariamente. Su función consiste con la compra de restos de madera en las carpinterias cercanas, luego instala hornos artesanales en donde coloca toda la madera obtenida, los cubre con aserrín, luego lo prende y espera durante algunas semanas hasta que la madera alcance su punto óptimo de horneado para convertirse en carbón. Lleva en este negocio más de 03 años y asegura que es una actividad muy sacrificada pero rentable. Trabaja con el apoyo de tres obreros y eventualmente con el apoyo de su yerno. Complementa este negocio con la venta de comida en su casa durante las noches.
Lo que le gusta de su labor es que puede trabajar y sentirse útil para su familia, le agrada sentir que tiene mucho más que dar para los demás, por si fuera poco asegura que el trato directo con las personas es lo que mas le gusta hacer , por está razón espera que su negocio se mantenga con el mismo ritmo de progreso.
Este es el crédito número 05 con Kiva, está muy contenta por el apoyo financiero que le están brindando ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su trabajo, por otro lado se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual .Con el monto solicitado de S/.1500 soles, comprará diversos cajones de madera descartada para luego utilizarlo en la producción de carbón.
texts.en: Doris, 54, is a widow with six children. Currently, she is only responsible for three of them. They are 22, 19, and 16 years old. She lives with them in her own home, which she built with a lot of effort and dedication. She works manufacturing charcoal. She rents some land far from the city that has been set aside for this purpose, and she works there every day. She buys leftover wood from nearby carpenters, and then she sets up ceramic ovens, where she puts all the wood she has collected. She covers it with sawdust and then lights it, and then waits several weeks until the wood is baked enough to be charcoal. She has had this business for three years, and she says that it is very demanding, but very profitable. She has three workers and occasionally works with her son-in-law. She also sells food in her home in the evenings. What she likes about her work is that she can work and feel useful to her family. It makes her feel good to know that she has more to give to others, even if it isn't much. She says that what she likes most is interacting with people. This is why she hopes that her business keeps growing at the same rhythm. This is her fifth Kiva loan. She is very glad for the financial support that she has received, because she feels confident that she can move forward with her work. She promises to make her payments on time. With the amount she is applying for, 1,500 soles, she will buy assorted boxes of discarded wood to use in manufacturing charcoal.

loans.use: to buy wood.

loans.name: Fernando

texts.en:
Peruvian artisan Fernando specializes in alpaca apparel. He would like to invest in the purchase of 100% alpaca yarn for production.

Fernando has been selling through NOVICA since 2011. This is his story:

"My artistic origins come from my family. My uncles worked in textiles and, little by little, they introduced me to this world. I love being able to translate materials into beautiful designs. My work means everything to me: it's what I love and cherish, and I love the fact that I can provide for my family, thanks to it.

"Many thanks for this great microcredit. It will allow me to buy sufficient alpaca yarn to build a good stock, especially in the main colors that I use for the designs you like most."

Use the link below to view Fernando's alpaca apparel on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/7883

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of 100% alpaca yarn for production.

loans.name: Tatul

texts.en:
Tatul is from Ijevan town, which is in the Tavush region. He lives with his parents, who are running a farm. The farming business helps their family to get income, which is vital for covering daily costs.

Tatul studies at Armenian State Engineering University in the economics department. It is very difficult for him to find a job because he has no working experience. Tatul has applied for this loan to pay for his university tuition. The loan is very important for him to be able to complete his education and become a good economist.

He dreams to have a good job and ensure a better life for his family.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition.

loans.name: Elizabeth's Group

texts.en:
Elizabeth is the coordinator of her group, Elizabeth's Group. This group is comprised of ten women entrepreneurs and is located in the city of San Pedro de Macoris. Their community is a rural area, surrounded by fields of sugarcane. 

Elizabeth works selling miscellaneous products, especially shoes. She will use her part of this loan to make purchases to increase her inventory. She lives with her long-term partner and their three children. Her most important challenges are to have a successful business and to provide everything her family needs. 

Elizabeth is receiving her 11th loan from Esperanza International Dominican Republic and because her previous loan repayments have all been made punctually, she has been able to grow her business with the new investment she makes from each loan. 

She started her business almost six years ago, by taking loans and investing the money in her business. She would like to save her profits for bigger investment in the future. She thanks you all for your support!!!

loans.use: to buy shoes and clothes to sell.

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
Santos, de 46 años de edad, está casado y tiene 2 hijos de 4 y 16 años de edad respectivamente, vive en su casa propia junto a los miembros de su familia.
El trabajo de Santos consiste en la elaboración de carbón por está razón alquila un espacio de terreno en una lejana zona de la ciudad en donde trabaja diariamente. Su trabajo consiste con la compra de madera descartada en las carpinterias cercanas, luego instala hornos artesanales en donde coloca toda la madera obtenida, los cubre con aserrín, luego lo prende y espera durante algunas semanas hasta que la madera alcance su punto óptimo de horneado para convertirse en carbón. Lleva en este negocio más de 05 años y asegura que es una actividad muy sacrificada pero rentable. Trabaja con el apoyo de dos obreros y eventualmente con el apoyo de su suegra. 
Lo que le gusta de su labor es que puede trabajar con algunos miembros de su familia, además está constantemente divirtiéndose con las amenas conversaciones que tiene con los dueños de otros hornos de su sector mientras esperan el producto terminado. Espera que su negocio se mantenga con el mismo ritmo de progreso.Este es el crédito número 05  con Kiva, está muy contento por el apoyo financiero que le están brindando ya que así se sentirá seguro de avanzar con su negocio, por otro lado se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.Con el monto solicitado de S/.3500 soles, comprará diversos cajones de madera descartada y alquilará el espacio que utiliza para continuar elaborando carbón.
texts.en: Santos, 46, is married and has two children, ages 4 and 16. He lives in his own house with his family. Santos makes charcoal, which is why he rents land in an area outside the city, where he works every day. He buys leftover wood from nearby carpenters. Then he installs ceramic ovens where he puts the wood. He covers it in sawdust, lights it, and then waits several weeks until the wood is baked enough to turn into charcoal. He has been in this business for more than five years and he says that it is very demanding, but profitable. He has with two workers and occasionally works with his mother-in-law. What he likes about his work is that he can work with some of his family members. He is also constantly having fun and pleasant conversations with the owners of other ovens in his area while they wait for their goods to be done. He hopes that his business keeps growing at the same rhythm. This is his fifth loan from Kiva. He is very glad for the financial support they are a providing to him, since he will feel secure in moving forward with his business. He promises to make his payments on time. With the amount he is asking for, 3,500 soles, he will buy several boxes of discarded wood and he will rent the space he uses to continue making charcoal.

loans.use: to buy wood and rent space to manufacture charcoal.

loans.name: Tereza

texts.es:
Tereza, de 42 años de edad, está casada y tiene un hijo de 17 años, vive en su casa propia el cual es fruto de su esfuerzo y dedicación. Todos los días trabaja arduamente para mejorar su calidad de vida.El trabajo de Tereza consiste principalmente en la elaboración de carbón. Ha destinado un espacio de terreno en una lejana zona de la ciudad cuyas áreas han sido cedidos para cumplir esta función y desde ahí trabaja diariamente. Cumple esta labor desde hace 02 años y lo hace durante las tardes ya que por las mañanas trabaja en una carpinteria, precisamente de ahí es de donde obtiene los restos de madera descartada que necesita para la fabricación del carbón. Empezó en este negocio ya que veía que la madera que desechaban se desperdiciaba, es así como decidió darle otro uso y aprovechar cada residuo de madera. Trabaja con ayuda de un obrero y de su pareja. Eventualmente vende frutas los fines de semana o cuando tiene tiempo libre. Lo que le gusta de su labor es que puede trabajar sin ninguna presión y generar sus propios ingresos, le agrada sentir que tiene mucho más que dar laboralmente, por si fuera poco asegura que el trato directo con las personas es lo que mas le gusta hacer. Espera que su negocio se mantenga con el mismo ritmo de progreso.
Este es el crédito número 04 con Kiva, está muy contenta por el apoyo financiero que le están brindando ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su trabajo y se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.Con el monto solicitado 1500 soles, comprará costales de madera y otros artículos que necesita para su trabajo.
texts.en: Tereza, 42, is married and has a 17-year-old son. She lives in her own house, which is the fruit of her effort and dedication. Every day, she works hard to improve her quality of life. Tereza makes charcoal. She has land in an area outside the city, which has been set aside for this purpose, and she works there every day. She has been doing this work for two years, and she works here in the afternoons and works in a carpentry shop in the mornings. This is where she gets the discarded wood that she needs to make charcoal. She started this business when she saw that the leftover wood was being wasted. This is how she decided to give it another use, and take advantage of every bit of leftover wood. She works with the help of her brother and her partner. Occasionally she sells fruit on the weekend or when she has free time. What she likes about her work is that she can work without pressure and earn her own income. She feels good about having more to give work-wise, even if it isn't much. She says that what she likes most is interacting with people. She hopes that her business keeps growing at the same rate. This is her fourth loan from Kiva. She is very glad for the financial support they are providing to her, since she will feel secure in moving forward with her business. She promises to make her payments on time. With the amount she is asking for, 1,500 soles, she will buy sacks of wood and other things that she needs for her work.

loans.use: to buy bags of wood and materials to make charcoal.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es: La Sra. Catalina de 56 años y su esposo el Sr. Martin, trabajan desde hace 4 años en la presidencia de nuestra localidad, realizando trabajos de gestión social. Cuentan con casa propia gracias al esfuerzo y trabajo de ambos; ella en ocasiones se dedica a la venta de ropa para ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos de la casa. Ambos solicitan de nuestro apoyo para cambiar el cableado eléctrico y así no tendrán la preocupación de que llegue a pasar algún incendio en su casa y así evitar pérdidas materiales e incluso la vida de ellos mismos.
texts.en: Catalina, 56, and her husband Martin have worked in our town's mayor's office for four years, doing social management work. They have their own house, thanks to their effort and work. Sometimes she sells clothing to help her husband with household expenses. They are both asking for our help to install new wiring in their home, so that they don't have to worry about a fire in their home. This way they can avoid material loses or losing their lives.

loans.use: to install new electric wiring in their house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a Guatemalan artisan who specializes in hand-woven natural and recycled accessories. She would like to invest in the purchase of zippers, fabric and thread for production. 

Maria has been selling through NOVICA since 2011. This is her story:

"After my mom died, I looked after my siblings. We always lived with financial constraints, below the minimum standard. That's why I grew up as a vegetarian; the situation forced us. I've been offering environmental education to a group of women, most of them homemakers, and we decided to call our group 'Enchanted Wings.' We want to fly--improve and charm clients with our products and history. People see me picking up wrappers in the street and ask why I want that 'garbage.' I tell them it isn't garbage, it's my prime material!"

"Thank you for your support! With this microcredit I'll be able to buy the materials I need, as well as afford to have more artisans assisting me. Thank you for appreciating my work, and many blessings to you."

Use the link below to view Maria's natural and recycled hand-woven accessories  on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/7831

loans.use: to purchase zippers, fabric and thread for production

loans.name: Sukartini

texts.en:
Sukartini is a Balinese artisan who specializes in silver and gemstone jewelry. She hopes to stock up on the materials she needs for production, such as sterling silver and gemstones.

Sukartini has been selling through NOVICA since 2005. This is her story:

"I am proud of my Indonesian heritage. My mother instilled in me the values of a 'Balinese woman,' including how to prepare temple offerings, because almost every day is a ceremonial occasion here. I took courses in other traditional art forms, but my favorite is silver. Today I work together with local silversmiths to promote Bali's beauty in our own way. We make different kinds of jewelry, mostly with sterling silver, in both traditional and modern styles.

"I would like to express my gratitude to all of you who fund this loan for my small silver craft business. This will help me to buy more material, which I hope will let me sell my work better and pay back the loan faster. Thank you so much!"

Use the link below to view Sukartini's handcrafted jewelry on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/4978

loans.use: to stock up on the materials she needs for production, such as sterling silver and gemstones.

loans.name: Wayan

texts.en:
Wayan, a Balinese artisan who carves incredible sculptures by hand, would like to invest in raw materials such as fine woods to increase production.

Wayan has been selling through NOVICA since 2004. This is his story:

"Most of my family members are carvers, for it is a family legacy that has endured several generations. You could say I was born with a talent to carve, which I developed by merely observing my parents and relatives at work every day. My inspiration comes from Balinese customs and traditions. Competition is hard here in Bali, for there are many expert carvers, making the life of a carver a very uncertain one. It means that I must excel, so hopefully my sculptures will be accepted."

"Thank you so much for the possibility to get this micro-credit loan. The money will help me buy wood so I can continue working. My wish is that this program can always continue and artisans can get support for our small businesses."

Use the link below to view Wayan's wood sculptures on the NOVICA site: http://www.novica.com/kiva/4352

loans.use: to invest in raw materials such as fine woods to increase production.

loans.name: Fe Y Accion 3 Group

texts.en:
Francisca is a member of the group Fe y Accion 3 (Faith and Action). This group, like many others, runs its businesses by walking through the community and selling from home. Most of them are selling clothes, shoes and jewelry, while others run beauty salons, grocery stores, etc. Francisca makes her home in a simple structure with her long term partner and their two children. They live in the rural area surrounding Hato Mayor, an agricultural area.

Francisca operates a clothing sales business. She has been in business for over a year, starting with some savings she had. While she says that her most important challenge is developing her business, she continues to enjoy it. She is excited to be taking her first loan with Esperanza. She plans to use her loan to invest by buying different clothes for kids, men and women, different styles, specially for spring-summer (Easter is one of the warmer weeks in Dominican Republic), and Francisca will use this loan to supply clothes for this season. She will use the profits to reinvest in her business. Francisca is very happy for your support and she wants to thank you in her group’s name and her own!

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Wayan

texts.en:
Wayan is a Balinese artisan who specializes in handcrafted jewelry. He would like to invest in the purchase of sterling silver for production.

Wayan has been selling through NOVICA since 2000. This is his story:

"I started to learn at the age of fifteen, as an apprentice in my village. After five years, I started on my own to produce original pieces that I sold to local shops. And slowly I was able to save enough money to make my own workshop at home, where I work still until this day. I am the eldest of three children from a family of artists, but I was the first in my family to work with silver.

"Thank you so much to everyone for your support through this microcredit. It will ease my efforts in preparing a replenishment stock. This microcredit will see my sales increase from year to year. Thank you so much."

Use the link below to view Wayan's jewelry on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/823

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of sterling silver for production.

loans.name: Kobina

texts.en:
Kobina is a Ghanaian artisan who specializes in designing hand-carved African masks. He would like to invest in the purchase of wood and metal plates for production.

Kobina has been selling through NOVICA since 2012. This is his story:

"My father painted, and I also have a flair for drawing and painting. This makes designing masks something that comes naturally to me. What I did to hone my skills was to visit art workshops where I could observe artisans. I was so eager to learn more, that I got a raw mask and started to make designs and paint it with acrylics. The outcome was very good, and that is how I started in this art form.

"I count myself lucky for having the opportunity of this microcredit to enhance my business. I am very grateful to those who contributed."

Use the link below to view Kobina's African masks on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/8495

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of wood and metal plates for production of his carvings.

loans.name: La Beneficiencia 2, 5 & 6 Group

texts.en:
Elimena is the group coordinator of La Beneficiencia 2, 5 & 6 (Beneficence), which is made up of 15 micro-entrepreneurs. She said that her most difficult challenge is to have a successful business.

Elimena operates a "colmado", a grocery store, where most of her neighbors buy their daily meals. She will use the loan to purchase many items like rice, sugar, cooking oil, canned meat, vegetables, flour, etc. to increase her business inventory. She is excited to receive her 12th loan with Esperanza International Dominican Republic since, with each loan, she has been able to make good investments in her business.

She represents women from Haiti who decided to start small businesses to supplement the insufficient incomes their households receive. She started her business when she received her first Esperanza International Dominican Republic loan, almost six years ago. This group is located in the city of San Pedro de Macoris, in one of the rural villages surrounding the main city. She enjoys attending church and working in her grocery store.

She thanks all of you for your support to her business and her group.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, cooking oil, canned meat, vegetables, flour, etc. for her store.

loans.name: Francisquenses Group

texts.en:
Paxixil is a rural area in San Francisco el Alto, in the Southwest region of Guatemala. The population of this area works in raising animals and working in agriculture. In addition, many are involved in the fabrication of traditional clothing and crafts. They are known for their embroidering and tailoring skills.

Six years ago, the Francisquenses Trust Bank was formed by several enthusiastic women. There are currently 16 members of the group. The women are pleased to have four new members. They are most aware that these new members must be responsible in order to uphold the good credit history of the Trust Bank. During the monthly meetings, the women receive training where they discuss topics such as health, family planning, and children’s rights, as well as business topics including budgeting and planning.

Magdalena is one of the new members of the Trust Bank. She is 31 years of age and has four children, ranging in age from 18 months to 13 years. Three of the children attend school. She has had two years of formal education, which is the average for the women in her Trust Bank.

Magdalena and her husband are tailors and make pants and jackets. They work for her brother and are paid by the pieces of clothing that they sew. However, Magdalena’s dream is to be independent, to produce more products and increase her income. After learning about Friendship Bridge and its Microcredit Plus program, she joined the Trust Bank and applied for her first loan in order to buy her own sewing machine. In this way, she can produce her own products and contact wholesalers. In addition, she will be better equipped to support her children’s education, so that they will enjoy a better future, perhaps a professional one!

The Francisquenses Trust Bank is most grateful to Friendship Bridge and Kiva investors. With the working capital that they provide in the form of loans, the women can become more independent, create or grow their businesses, and move themselves, their families, and community forward into a brighter future.

loans.use: to by a sewing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to update his computer equipment and software in order to fulfill a signed contract.

loans.name: Estela

texts.en:
Estela is 47 years old, widowed, with two children. She lives in Jiminez, Misamis Occdiental. To earn a living, she owns and operates a motorcycle transport in the local community. She has been in her business for over five years and earns PHP 9,000 every month. 

She joined Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) in the year 2010 and now she has requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase spare parts and tires for her motorcycle and to make repairs. Her hopes and dreams are to improve her living situation and to provide education for her children.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and tires for her motorcycle and to make repairs.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
Amelia opened her kiosk in 2003 with her own working capital of $200. She is generating a good income from selling. 

A $1,000 loan will help Amelia to improve her business. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store, such as fish and fishing materials. 

Amelia has been thinking of running a big business after years of involving herself in doing business. She is living in a town with her family, and her husband is a fisherman.

loans.use: to buy fish and fishing materials.

loans.name: Filomena

texts.en:
Filomena has a kiosk where many people come to buy every day. A $600 loan will help Filomena to improve her business. She will buy some additional supplies such as noodles, fish, books, pans, Fanta, Coca-Cola, Sprite, salt, biscuits, sugar and coffee.

She has been involving herself in business activities since 2002. She feels so comfortable to run her business because she can earn money every day.

Filomena’s running a business has made her independent because she can be responsible for herself and also help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy noodles, fish, books, pans, Fanta, Coca-Cola, Sprite, salt, biscuits, sugar and coffee.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more dried fish to sell

loans.name: Creando Redes Group

texts.es: Don Javier, en la foto es el único hombre que aparece, pertenece al Banco Comunal Creando Redes, y está ubicado en Concepción, VIII Región de Chile. Sus socios se dedican a la venta de ropa usada, a vender desayunos en ferias libres, sastrería y moda; y el negocio de él está dedicado a la mecánica y a la pastelería.  Comenzó su negocio hace nueve años, producto de un accidente del que fue víctima se vio en la obligación de buscar otros medios de donde obtener recursos, hizo un curso de mecánico automotriz, que no pudo concluir, y además trabajo en Panaderías, en donde pudo aprender a hacer tortas pasteles y galletas. Tuvo que afrontar la pérdida de su mujer y su familia, que lo dejaron solo a raíz de su accidente que lo dejo inválido, pero Javier tuvo el coraje de salir adelante y hacer cursos para aprender. A pesar de esa pena de su vida, él actualmente tiene pareja que lo ha ayudado y lo ha apoyado en todo lo que ha podido para que él pueda surgir. Javier podrá ocupar este crédito que se le otorgara en comprar insumos para su pequeña pastelería, además de una batidora y moldes que son básicos para su trabajo; además de estar seguro de que será un muy buen ciclo para su negocio, y en donde podrá incluso pagar cuotas adelantadas. Lo que más le ha gustado de trabajar con Fondo Esperanza es el poder conocer gente muy responsable y además de tener una excelente asesora, con una gran disponibilidad para resolver todas sus inquietudes.
texts.en: Javier, the only man in the photo, belongs to the Creando Redes Communal Bank, which is located in Concepción, in the 8th Region of Chile.  Its members sell used clothing, sell breakfasts at open fairs, work in tailoring, and work in fashion, and his business is auto mechanics and pastry making.  He started his business nine years ago after he got into an accident and had to find other ways to earn an income.  He took an auto mechanics course that he could not complete and he worked in bakeries, where he was able to learn how to make cakes and cookies.  He had to face the loss of his wife and family, who left him on his own after the accident that left him crippled, but Javier had the courage to get ahead and take courses to learn.  Despite this pain in his life, he currently has a partner who has helped him and supported him in every way possible so he can get ahead.  Javier will use this loan to buy supplies for his small pastry shop, as well as a mixer and molds, which are staples for his work.  He is sure that this will be a very good season for his business and thinks he will even be able to make his payments ahead of time.  What he likes most about working with Fondo Esperanza is getting to meet very responsible people, as well as having a great adviser who is great at assuaging his concerns.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his small pastry shop

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Celicia

texts.en:
A loan of $1000.00 is being offered to Celicia to improve her business. She has a kiosk where many people come to buy every day. She will buy some additional supplies such as biscuits, noodles, sugar, and coffee. She has been involving herself in business activities since 2004. She feels very comfortable to run her business because she can earn money every day.

Running a business has made Celicia   independent because she can be responsible for herself and also help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy some additional supplies such as biscuits, noodles, sugar, and coffee

loans.name: Martina

texts.en:
Martina is a 47-year-old married woman and a mother of six children from Getafe, Bohol. She is engaged in selling firewood at the market. Her husband works as a fisherman.

Martina is asking for a loan to buy more firewood to sell and new fishing nets. Martina believes that this loan can help her in improving her business.

loans.use: to buy more firewood to sell and new fishing nets

loans.name: Marisa

texts.en:
Marisa is 39 years old and married with one child. She lives in Jiminez, Misamis Occidental. 

Marisa owns and operates a motorcycle transport business in the local community to earn a living. She has been in her business for over six years and earns 9,000 PHP every month. She joined GDMPC in the year 2010, and now she has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase spare parts and tires. 

Marisa’s hopes and dreams are to have a better future and improve their living situation.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and tires.

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita is a married woman and a mother of seven children from Getafe, Bohol. She has been engaged in the fishing business for several years now. Pacita works hard to support her husband in meeting the needs of the family, especially for the schooling of their children. 

As of now, Pacita is requesting a loan to buy new fishing nets, bamboo and other fishing materials. 

Pacita dreams of expanding her business so that it will generate more income necessary for the needs of the family and for the schooling of their children.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, bamboo and other fishing materials

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
Víctor de 40 años de edad tiene 4 hijos con quienes vive en su casa construida a base de adobe. Víctor se dedica a la agricultura  por esta razón siembra productos agropecuarios tales como el cacao, café , yuca y maíz , tiene más de 20 años de experiencia en este rubro y cuenta con terrenos propios .
Lo más reconfortante de su actividad es que gracias a ello puede brindar una buena educación a sus hijos y darles las comodidades que necesitan en su hogar pero también tiene el deseo de adquirir un lote para vivienda en la ciudad de Lima en donde planea construir una casa y enviar a sus hijos para que puedan estudiar alguna carrera superior o técnica .
Dentro de sus requerimientos para continuar con su normal desempeño en la próxima temporada de café debe adquirir plantas de almacigo así como contratar personal suficiente para culminar el trabajo de mantenimiento respectivo en menos de 1 mes por esta razón requiere de su ayuda y se muestra muy agradecido con el apoyo financiero que le brinda Kiva para continuar con su negocio.
Con los S/. 3000 soles contratará a trabajadores del lugar para culminar en menos de un mes las labores en sus terrenos y así obtener buenos frutos .
texts.en:
Forty-year-old Victor has four children who live with him in their adobe home.  Victor works in farming for a living, which is why he grows such produce as cacao, coffee, yucca, and corn.  He has over twenty years of experience in this work and he has his own fields. 

The most comforting thing about his work is that it allows him to offer his children a good education and give them the comforts they need at home.  However, he also wants to get a plot for a house in the city of Lima where he plans to build a house and send his children so they can pursue a bachelors or technical degree.

In order to continue with the next coffee season according to plan, he needs to get copperwood plants and hire enough labor to finish the required maintenance in under one month.  This is why he needs your help and he is very thankful for the financial support Kiva offers him to continue with his business.

With the 3,000 soles he will hire laborers from the area to finish the work in his fields in under one month, which will give him a good harvest.

loans.use: to hire laborers from the area

loans.name: Saltanat

texts.ru: Салтанат 32 года, замужем, воспитывает 3 детей. В качестве источника дохода для своей семьи, Салтанат занимается животноводством и полеводством, начав этот бизнес в 13 лет назад сразу после свадьбы. Благодаря упорному труду Салтанат, ее бизнес, начатый с 10,000 KGS, на сегодняшний день насчитывает 2 дойных коров 5 овец, что позволяет ей иметь прибыль в сумме 7,000 сом (KGS) с месяц с продажи молока и молочных продуктов и перепродажи скота. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Салтанат обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительных голов скота. Доходы от кредита Салтанат планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение бизнеса и мечтает сделать дома ремонт.
texts.en:
Saltanat is thirty-two years old, married and has three children. Her main source of income comes from farming, a business she began thirteen years ago, right after her wedding. Thanks to her hard work and dedication, her business, started from a sum of 10,000 KGS, now consists of two milking cows and five sheep, which brings her a monthly income of 7,000 soms. 

Wishing to expand her business even further, Saltanat approached "Bai Tushum and Partners" with a request for a loan of 50,000 soms. This loan would allow her to purchase some cattle. Saltanat plans to reinvest the profits from this loan back into her business and also dreams of fixing up her home.

loans.use: To purchase cattle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy items to sell ( Goods , Snacks , Drinks )

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for the maintenance of her motorcycle ( gasoline, oil change, and motor parts)

loans.name: Upendo Group

texts.en:
Everlyne’s group has 12 farmers and is located in the Chwele District. Everlyne is pictured on the right of the Upendo Group with her hand raised. Everlyne is pictured amongst the 12 women of her group. She will receive input loans capable of planting ½ an acre with sorghum, sweet potatoes and millet. Everlyne first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2010 Long Rains and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. Everlyne joined One Acre Fund in order to gain access to hybrid seeds and fertilizer, as well as to improve her farming techniques with One Acre Fund methods.

Prior to joining One Acre Fund, Everlyne was only able to harvest 1.5 bags of maize per ½ acre, but after joining One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2012, she was able to harvest 9 bags per ½ acre! She plans on using future profits from the harvest to send her children to school and save for the future. During the 2013 Long Rains season, each group member will receive ½ an acre of agricultural inputs on credit. Everlyne’s group will receive 6 acres worth of inputs on credit.

The field officer is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of millet, sweet potatoes, and sorghum.

loans.name: Adela

texts.es:
Adela tiene 23 años de edad y esta casada con Raul con quien vive en una casa construida a base de madera. Adela se dedica a la agricultura por esta razón siembra cacao y café orgánico ya que  este es un producto muy comercial en su zona ya que posee un clima tropical  y un suelo húmedo el cual facilita su crecimiento con calidad comercial. Teniendo en cuenta las condiciones técnicas para sembrar cacao y café, se debe dar un mantenimiento constante a los sembríos el cual incluye extraer la maleza y la aplicación de abono orgánico ,por esta razón contrata trabajadores del lugar quienes trabajan en estas labores.Sus objetivos a largo plazo apuntan a seguir trabajando de manera uniforme e iniciar la construcción de su vivienda a base de material noble a manera de brindarle una buena calidad de vida a su futura familia.Este es su primer crédito con KIva y se muestra muy agradecida por la oportunidad  brindada y se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
Para esta oportunidad desea contar con S/. 1,000 soles y destinarlos a la compra de abono orgánico.
texts.en:
Adela is 23 years old and married to Raul.  They live in a house built from wood. 

Adela works as a farmer planting cacao and organic coffee.  This product is very commercial in her area which has a tropical climate and moist soil which facilitates crop growth at commercial quality.  Given the technical conditions needed to plant cacao and coffee, she has to provide constant maintenance to the crops, which includes weeding and applying organic fertilizer.  In order to do this, she hires local workers.

Her long term objectives are to continue working consistently and to start construction on a home made from more substantial materials in order to provide her future family a better quality of life.  This is her first loan with Kiva and she is very grateful for the opportunity provided and promises to make her payments on time.

She is requesting 1000 soles to purchase organic fertilizer.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Samvel

texts.ru:
Samvel is a skilled carpenter. He still engaged in production of doors, furniture, souvenirs from wood, which he performs in separated workroom in his house.
Souvenirs Samvel sells in one of the famous souvenirs shop in Vanadzor city, doors and furniture in building materials shop in Vanadzor city. Samvel works also in enterprises in Vanadzor city as a carpenter. 
Samvel is 51 years old and lives with his wife and two sons. Both of them study in Yerevan State Medical University and are promising students. Samvel is very proud of them.
