Samvel works as a carpenter many years. He loves his profession and works with great pleasure. Samvel has a good repute not only in Vanadzor city, but also in whole Lori Region.
Due to his occupation he is able to sustain his family. With first loan from Kiva he bought large amount of ceramic dish-ware, so he expanded his business volume. 
Now Samvel is seeking 1,000,000 Armenian Drams loan to buy more wood in order to expand his business volume. His big dream is to create his own big manufacturing company in Vanadzor city.
texts.en:
Samvel is a skilled carpenter. He is still engaged in the production of doors, furniture and souvenirs from wood, which he performs in a workroom in his house.
Samvel sells souvenirs in one of the famous souvenir shops in Vanadzor city, and sells doors and furniture in a building materials shop in Vanadzor city. Samvel works also works as a carpenter for various enterprises.

Samvel is 51 years old and lives with his wife and two sons. Both of them attend Yerevan State Medical University and are promising students. Samvel is very proud of them. Samvel has worked as a carpenter many years. He loves his profession and works with great pleasure. Samvel has a good reputation not only in Vanadzor city, but also in whole Lori Region.
Due to his occupation he is able to sustain his family. With his first loan from Kiva he bought a large amount of ceramic dish-ware, so he expanded his business volume. 
Now Samvel is seeking a loan of 1,000,000 Armenian Drams in order to buy more wood so that he can expand his business. His big dream is to create his own big manufacturing company in Vanadzor city.

loans.use: To buy more wood in order to expand his business volume.

loans.name: Sozulkan

texts.ru: Созулкан благодарит всех инвесторов фонда КИВА за поддержку. На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Созулкан имеется 2 коровы, 3 бычка и 7 овец. Также имеется 1,5 га земли. Ежемесячный доход от скотоводства составляет около 8,000 KGS. От полеводства Созулкан имеет около 100,000 сом ежегодно. Созулкан обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS)  на закуп дополнительных голов скота. Доходы Созулкан планирует вкладывать в развитие бизнеса и постройку нового дома.
texts.en:
Sozulkan sends her thanks to all Kiva lenders for support. To date, Sozulkan's farm has two cows, three calves, and seven sheep. She also has 1.5 hectares of land. Monthly income from livestock is about 8,000 KGS. From agriculture, Sozulkan brings in about 100,000 som annually. 

Sozulkan turned to Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan of 80,000 som (KGS) to buy additional heads of livestock. 

Sozulkan plans to invest income into business development and to build a new home.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Njinyosie Group

texts.en:
Issabel's group has 10 farmers and is located in Chwele District. Issabel is pictured on the right of the Njinyosie Group with her hand raised. Issabel is pictured amongst the 3 men and 7 women of her group. She will receive input loans capable of planting ½ an acre with sorghum, sweet potatoes and millet. Issabel joined One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2012, and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2013 season. Issabel joined One Acre Fund so that she could be assured of reliable input delivery and access to the best input prices.

Issabel reports that before One Acre Fund, she was able to grow about 3.5 bags of maize per ½ acre, but with her One Acre Fund input loan during Long Rains 2012, she harvested 7.5 bags per ½ acre! She hopes that her profits from the 2013 Long Rains season can be used to send her children to school and repair her home. For the 2013 Long Rains season, Issabel’s group members will take input loans of ½ acre each. In total, this group will receive input loans for use on 5 acres of land.   

The field officer is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of millet, sweet potatoes, and sorghum.

loans.name: Brilla El Sol Group

texts.es: Brilla el Sol, es un Banco Comunal ubicado en la VIII Región del Biobío, Ruby, que está parada  al costado derecho con polera verde y de lentes, es una de sus socias, la cual nos entrega su testimonio de como ha sido participar de Fondo Esperanza. En el Banco Comunal en el cual participa, los socios y ella, trabajan ofreciendo sus productos en la Feria Candelaria, algunos de ellos venden Ropa Usada, carros para la feria, escobillones, cerámica, calzado; y Ruby se dedica a la venta de productos congelados, como lo son la merluza, camarones, para pre-fritas, papas duquesas, jaiba, además de vegetales congelados como choclo, habas, porotos verdes, zanahoria y arvejas. Su negocio lo comenzó hace dos años, cuando en un curso hecho ne la Municipalidad de San Pedro, pudo capacitarse como manipuladora de alimentos lo que le ayudo a facilitar lo que ahora es su trabajo. Desafíos ha tenido bastantes, pero  siempre ha sido totalmente apoyada por su familia, y más ahora por su hijo, quien le ayuda a promocionar sus productos por internet y cuando captan clientes es él el encargado de ayudarla en el traslado de los productos para que conserven su congelado. Con su esfuerzo y ahorro ha podido comprarse un auto usado y pequeño, pero que le ha servido para el traslado de sus productos. El préstamo al que podrá acceder le servirá justamente para poder abastecerse de más productos para poder vender, en estas fechas acá en Chile, por ser semana Santa, las personas no consumen carne, solo productos del mar, y así ella vendería mucho más, lo cual sería muy bueno para su negocio, así proyecta que sería un muy buen periodo. En Fondo Esperanza, ha conocido muy buenas personas, además de ser una participación gratificante, ayudándola también a tener muchas más ganas de surgir, en donde hay mucho respeto y ayuda de partes de los asesores. Nos cuanta además que encontró amigas en su Banco Comunal, ya que  el día que les toco pagar alguna cuota de créditos anteriores, se juntaban con sus compañeras y se disponían a compartir de una once preparadas por ellas, haciendo queques o galletas. En resumen una participación gratificante.
texts.en:
"Brilla el Sol" is a communal bank located in the Vlll Bío Bío Region. Ruby, who is standing on the right side with a green T-shirt and glasses, is one of the members and this is her account of how it has been to participate in Fondo Esperanza. In the communal bank in which she participates, the members, including her, work selling their products in the Candelaria market. Some of them sell used clothing, carts for the market, brushes, ceramics and footwear. 

Ruby sells frozen products such as hake, shrimp, frozen french fries and potato puffs, as well as frozen vegetables such as corn, lima beans, green beans, carrots and peas. She started her business two years ago when she took a course in the town of San Pedro, where she was trained in food handling, which helped her get into what now is her business.

She has had quite a few challenges, but has always been fully supported by her family, and more now by her son, who helps her to promote her products via the Internet. When they get customers, he is the one responsible for helping her transport the products so that they stay frozen. 

With her effort and savings she has been able to buy herself a small used car that has been useful in transporting her products. The loan she will be able to access will enable her to stock more products to sell. At this time of year here in Chile, because it is Holy Week, people don't eat meat, only seafood products, and she would sell much more, which would be very good for her business—so she projects that it would be a very good sales period.

At Fondo Esperanza, she has got to gotten to know very good people, and besides her participation has been rewarding, also helping her to have a much greater desire to succeed. There is a lot of respect there and help from the advisers. She also tells us that she has made friends through her communal bank, as when the day comes to make a payment for previous loans, they get together with their fellow members and prepare a light meal, making cakes or cookies. In short, a rewarding experience.

loans.use: To buy frozen food products.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es:
Alejandro de 22 años de edad , es soltero y vive en la casa de sus padres.Desde muy niño siempre fue participe en las diversas actividades que desempeñaban sus padres para el sustento de su familia razón por la cual se dedica a sembrar cacao orgánico a tiempo completo,además gracias al apoyo de sus padres y como agradecimiento por su trabajo sus padres le regalaron un terreno agrícola para que el lo trabaje de manera independiente .Tuvo dificultades para iniciar sus primeras cosechas pero con  el tiempo ha ido perfeccionándose logrando ser un gran agricultor. Alejandro tiene pensado adquirir mas terrenos para la expandir su producción tanto como para cacao y café orgánico.
Es su primera experiencia con Kiva y se siente muy agradecido por la oportunidad que se le brinda puesto que considera los créditos otorgados una buena herramienta de trabajo.
Desea contar con S/.1,500 soles para la compra de plantas de almácigo de cacao y sacos de abono orgánico esperando así la próxima campaña para recuperar su inversión.
texts.en: Alejandro is a single 22-year old man and lives in his parents' house. From the time he was very young, he always participated in the family's various economic activities so that they could support themselves. He now works full-time growing organic cacao. Further, as a way of thanking him for his hard work, his parents have graciously given him his own plot of land so he can work independently. At first he had difficulties getting his crops going, but with time he has perfected his procedures and is now a skilled farmer. He wishes to acquire more land so that he can expand his production and grow both organic cacao and coffee. This is his first experience with Kiva, and he is very grateful for the loan opportunity. He believes that such loans will be a helpful tool for his work. He is seeking 1,500 nuevos soles in order to buy bags of organic fertilizer and cacao plants for transplanting. He hopes that he will be able to recoup his investment with the next harvest.

loans.use: to buy cacao plants and organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Zinaida

texts.ru: Зинаида 52 года, разведена. Зинаида воспитала одну дочь. Зинаида имеет среднее образование. По хозяйству помагает  дочка. с 2009 года зинаида занимается животноводством. Зинаидаа обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 90,000 сом (KGS) на увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Зинаидаа будет вкладывать в дальнейшее увеличение бизнеса.
texts.en:
Zinaida is 52 years old and divorced. Zinaida raised one daughter. Zinaida has a high school education. Her daugher helps with the housework. 

Since 2009, Zinaida has been engaged in raising livestock. Zinaida turned to Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan of 90,000 som (KGS) to increase the number of livestock. 

Zinaida will invest income from the loan to further increase business.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle

loans.name: Abel

texts.es:
Abel de 29 años de edad , esta casado con Etsenia y juntos tienen una hija de 5 años de edad respectivamente con quien vive en su casa construida a base de adobe .Desde muy joven tuvo un gran rol como hijo apoyando a sus padres en las tareas agrícolas correspondientes a la producción de cacao orgánico siendo este el sustento para su hogar.
Con el paso de los años y viéndose obligado a buscar un ingreso económico fijo para su nueva familia optó por dedicarse a la agricultura razón por la cual compro su propio terreno en donde se dedica a sembrar cacao orgánico.Para el normal desempeño de su trabajo debe de contar con el apoyo de trabajadores del lugar especialmente en la época de cosecha ya que no se puede sobrepasar el limite de madures según las especificaciones técnicas referentes al plan productivo de cacao.
Finalmente obtenido los granos de cacao debe de ser secado y posteriormente vendido a los establecimientos de cacao quienes le remuneran por sus productos de acuerdo a la calidad obtenida , lleva en esta actividad un promedio de nueve años y tiene deseos de seguir superándose por el bien de su familia.
Este es su primer préstamo con Kiva, motivo por el cual se siente agradecido y se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
Para esta primera ocasión desea contar con S/. 1,000 soles para comprar yeso y fortalecer las paredes externas de su vivienda la cual se encuentra ubicada en sus terrenos agrícolas.
texts.en:
Abel is 29 year sold, and lives with his wife, Etsenia, and their five-year-old daughter in an adobe home. From a very young age, Abel helped his parents work their organic cacao farming operation, and agriculture has always been the livelihood and source of income for his family.

Over time, as Abel became a father and husband and took on new responsibilities, he decided to start his own farming operation and purchase some farm land for cultivating organic cacao. Abel works extremely hard to tend and cultivate his cacao crops, and during the harvest season he hires additional workers to help with the increased workload. Time is of the essence during the harvest, as cacao fruit cannot be harvested when it is over ripe and still be in compliance with industry standards.

After Abel harvests the cacao fruit, he extracts the seeds and dries them. He sells his seeds to establishments that pay varying rates for high quality versus low quality cacao. Abel has nine years of experience in this trade, and he plans to continue with his farming operation for the benefit of his family.  Abel is very grateful for the opportunity of this, his first loan, and he promises to make all scheduled loan repayments on time. He plans to use the support from this loan to purchase plaster and mortar for use in shoring up and strengthening the walls of his home, which is located in the middle of his farmland.

loans.use: to purchase plaster and mortar for strengthening the walls of his home.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is applying for a loan of $1,000 from TRM (Tuba Rai Metin). She is 28 years old. Maria runs a kiosk in front of her house, and she will use the loan to buy stocks of items such as fish canes, oil, sugar, biscuits, and rice to keep in her store. She is making good money selling her goods, and she wants to apply for a bigger loan in the future. 
Maria lives near the school in her town. Her kiosk is located in a strategic place where many people, including students, come to buy items.

loans.use: to buy fish canes, oil, sugar, biscuits, and rice to sell.

loans.name: Elena

texts.ru:
Елена занимается выращиванием овощей на своем участке в г Каменка-Днепровская уже 15 лет. Она живет с мужем и сыном, которые помогают ей в этом бизнесе. Выращивают помидоры, огурцы и редис.

Чтобы справляться с сезонностью цен и конкуренцией каждый год приходится много вкладывать в развитие бизнеса. Сначала Елена сделала один вид отопления, на следующий год - другой вид отопления. В этом году поставили большой паровой котел. Сейчас нужен кредит, так как не хватает собственных средств на уголь.

У Елены есть планы развивать бизнес дальше. Недавно Елена с мужем купили дом по соседству с земельным участком, будут там строить теплицы, увеличивая тем самымм обороты в бизнесе и финансовые возможности своей семьи.

Примечание: на фото Елена с мужем.
texts.en:
Elena has been engaged in growing vegetables on her own plot in Kamenka-Dneprovskaya for 15 years. She lives with her husband and son, who help her with this business. They grow tomatoes, cucumbers, and radishes.

In order to cope with seasonality of prices and competition that comes each year, she needs to invest a lot into business development. Elena first did one type of heating, and the following year did another kind of heating. This year, they installed a large boiler. Now, she needs a loan because they do not have enough money for coal.

Elena has plans to develop the business further. Recently, Elena and her husband bought a house in the neighborhood with a plot of land and will build a greenhouse there, increasing the momentum of the business and the financial capabilities of their family. 

Note: in the photo are Elena and her husband.

loans.use: to buy coal for heating

loans.name: Akukuranut Group

texts.en:
Esther is a member of Akukuranut Group in Teso District. She is pictured with 10 other One Acre Fund farmers. Their group consists of 4 women and 7 men. Esther is standing on the right with her hand raised. She is receiving an input loan for ½ acre of millet, sweet potatoes and sorghum cultivation. Esther is a new One Acre Fund farmer and is excited for the 2013 "Long Rains" season. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access the best input prices and to grow enough food for the family.

Esther described her harvest last year as poor. She hopes that, as a One Acre Fund farmer, she is able to join the ranks of One Acre Fund farmers that have doubled their harvest in their first year of the program. She hopes that her profits from the 2013 Long Rains season can be used to send her children to school and to save for the future. For the 2013 Long Rains season, Esther's group members will take input loans of ½ acre each. In total, this group will receive input loans for use on 5.5 acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of millet, sweet potatoes, and sorghum.

loans.name: Popchin

texts.en:
Popchin is a married woman. She and her husband have two children: one is 5 years old, while the other is 9 years old. She describes herself as a hardworking and intelligent woman.

To earn a living, she operates a food retail store, where she sells food items such as cereals, maize, beans, green gram, and millet. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located near a busy bus station, so her primary customers are passengers and daily consumers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be her low bargaining power and competition within the area.

She is seeking this loan in the amount of 60,000 KES to buy more maize, beans, black beans, green gram, and millet to re-sell to her customers. Her business goal is to expand her business within five years. Notably, this would be her third loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to expand her business by purchasing additional maize, beans, black beans, green gram, and millet

loans.name: Fares

texts.en:
Fares is a 24-year-old, single man living in Sana`a, Yemen. For two years now he has worked as a driver for a company. He is the head of his household, so his income helps cover his expenses, such as food and other living essentials. He strives to support himself and his family.

He has been saving money to buy a car, but he has insufficient capital to do so. As a result, he is requesting a youth loan in the amount of 350,000 YER from AMB to buy a taxi, which will help him cover his daily expenses. He explains that he needs Kiva's support because he has great aspirations to improve his and his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to more easily cover his living expenses by purchasing a taxi

loans.name: Lia

texts.es:
Lía tiene 49 años de edad y está casada con Mario con quien tiene 3 hijos ,juntos viven en su casa construida a base de adobe.Lía se desempeña como agricultora de  cacao orgánico y café ya que desde muy joven buscó y a  hallo un buen sustento en dicha actividad contando desde ya con el apoyo de su esposo.
Inicialmente no contaba con un terreno propio que le permitiera obtener ganancias liquidas en cuanto a los mazorcas de cacao y café. No obstante con el paso de los años y acumulando capital necesario logró adquirir una terreno el cual destinó íntegramente a la producción de cacao  y café orgánico.
Comenta que su actividad es cansada y reconfortante puesto que es muy necesario brindarle al mantenimiento constante a sus plantaciones tales como son la colocación de sombras y aplicación de abono orgánico para obtener una buena cosecha ,todo ello debe ser desempeñado y la mejor de manera de llevarlo a cabo es con el apoyo de trabajadores que debe de contratar constantemente.
Con el paso del tiempo y la expectativa ganada por los años de experiencia espera seguir trabajando con la fuerza que la caracteriza y a futuro adquirir parcelas adicionales para dedicarlos a la producción de barbasco y así asegurar la educación de sus hijos. Este es su primer préstamo Kiva y se siente muy agradecida por la oportunidad brindada puesto que es necesario un soporte económico constante para el desempeño de sus labores.
Requiere contar con S/. 2,000 soles contratará trabajadores para desempeñar la respectiva cosecha de campaña próxima, asimismo solventar los gastos de traslado y compra de sacos esperando obtener buenas ganancias.
texts.en: Lía is 49 years old and has three children with her husband Mario. They live together in their adobe house. Lía works hard as a farmer of organic cacao and coffee. From the time she was very young, she has found this to be a good means of supporting herself. Now she also has the support of her husband. Initially she did not have her own land, which would have enabled her to make profits from her cacao and coffee crops. However, with the passing of the years she was able to accumulate the necessary capital to get her own plot to grow these crops. She reports that her work is tiring and challenging, since it is very much necessary to perform constant maintenance on her crops, such as placing sunshades and applying organic fertilizer so that she can obtain a good harvest. All of this is arduous, and the best way to complete this work is with the support of hired laborers who work continually. With the passage of time and the confidence gained from her years of experience, she hopes to keep working with her characteristic dedication. In the future, she also wishes to acquire more parcels of land that can be dedicated to the production of barbasco plants so that she can ensure that her children get an education. This is her first loan through Kiva, and she is very thankful for the opportunity since it is necessary to have continual financial support for the work of the laborers. She is seeking 2,000 nuevos soles to hire laborers for the next growing season. She will also use the funds to pay for transportation and bags in the hopes of increasing her earnings.

loans.use: to hire laborers.

loans.name: Marina

texts.ru:
Марина занимается выращиванием ранних овощей в теплицах уже 13 лет. В начале узнала технологии, затем начала пробовать, стало получаться - стала развиваться. Сегодя Марина имеет хороший урожай и хорошую прибыль. 

Раньше у Марины был небольшой участок, теперь ее бизнес расширился. Недавно Марина приобрела земельный участок — нужно его огородить. Марина просит предоставить ей кредит на постройку забора вокруг нового участка, а также на ремонт существующих теплиц - нужно закупить пленку и шланги для системы полива.

Старшая дочь учится и живет в городе Днепропетровск (200 миль от родителей), сын живет с родителями, ходит в школу.
texts.en:
Marina has been engaged in the cultivation of early vegetables in greenhouses for 13 years. In the beginning, she learned the technologies, then began to try, and it came to be - it was developed. Today, Marina has a good harvest and good profits. 

Previously, Marina had a small plot, and now her business has expanded. Marina recently acquired land — and needs to fence it in. Marina is asking for a loan to build a fence around the new site, as well as to repair the existing greenhouses - and needs to purchase film and irrigation hoses. 

Her eldest daughter is studying and living in the town of Dnepropetrovsk (200 miles from her parents), and her son lives with his parents and goes to school.

loans.use: to buy plastic film, drip irrigation, and timber for fencing

loans.name: Reuben

texts.en: Reuben is a 30 year old married man. He has four children, ranging from one to eleven years old. He describes himself as a hardworking man. He operates a retail business selling paraffin. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located within a busy shopping center and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the shortage of funds for improving the business. He will use the 50,000 KES loan to buy paraffin to sell. His business goal is to expand his business within five years. In addition, Reuben does farming which increases his business income.

loans.use: to buy paraffin to sell

loans.name: Nawinyi Group

texts.en:
Judith’s group has 8 farmers and is located in Teso District. Judith is pictured on the right of Nawinyi Group, with her hand raised. Judith is pictured with the one man and six other women of her group. She will receive input loans to help her farm ½ an acre with sweet potatoes, sorghum, and millet. Judith first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2010 "Long Rains" season and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. Judith joined One Acre Fund in order to gain access to hybrid seeds and fertilizers, which enable her to generate additional profits to send her children to school.

Prior to joining One Acre Fund, Judith was only able to harvest two bags of maize per ½ acre, but after joining One Acre Fund, and during the Long Rains' 2012 season, she was able to harvest ten bags per ½ acre! She plans on using future profits from the harvest to send her children to school and to save for the future. During the 2013 Long Rains season, each group member will receive ½ an acre of agricultural inputs on credit. Judith’s group will receive four acres worth of inputs on credit.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seedx and fertilizers for the cultivation of millet, sweet potatoes, and sorghum.

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en:
Andrew is a 20-year-old, single man. He describes himself as an innovative man.

To earn a living, he operates a general store, where he provides mobile-phone services (e.g., Safaricom M-pesa) to customers and sells phone accessories. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located in a busy area, and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds, which makes it difficult to expand and improve the business.

He plans on using the requested loan in the amount of 20,000 KES to purchase phone accessories to re-sell to his customers. His business goal is to run a fully-stocked business within five years.

loans.use: to expand and improve his business by purchasing phone accesories to re-sell to customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more items to sell (goods, snacks, drinks)

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth is a married woman. She has 3 children. She describes herself to be a determined and hard working woman. She operates a general store where she sells items such as paint and glue amongst others. Her business is located in a viable business area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy iron sheets and cement for building a water tank in her basement. Her business goal is to improve her business within 5 years. Ruth also adds her business income from the agrovet business which she runs. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy iron sheets and cement for building a water tank in her basement

loans.name: Nguvu Group

texts.en:
Dismas is pictured on the right with his hand raised amongst his Nguvu Group members. The 10 of them, 6 women and 4 men, are farmers in the Teso District. Farming inputs will be delivered to him on credit consisting of the necessary materials to plant ½ acre of millet, sweet potatoes and sorghum. Dismas joined One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2012, and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2013 season. Dismas joined One Acre Fund so that he could gain access to hybrid seed and fertilizer and use the increased profits to send his children to school.

Prior to joining One Acre Fund, Dismas was only able to harvest 3 bags of maize per ½ acre, but after joining One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2012, he was able to harvest 9 bags per ½ acre! He plans on using future profits from the harvest to send his children to school and repair his home. Dismas’ group members will each receive input loans of ½ acre during the 2013 Long Rains season. In total they will receive inputs for 5 acres of millet, sweet potatoes and sorghum.

Simon, one of the farmers of Nguvu Group, chose to drop out of the program after the Kiva photo was taken. He is still pictured above.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of millet, sweet potatoes, and sorghum.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a married woman. She has 5 children with ages ranging from 5 to 20 years. She describes herself as a focused woman. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in a very busy business environment and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the language barrier when selling to customers. She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy clothes to sell. Her business goal is to be a wholesaler of clothing within 5 years. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM after having repaid her previous loans of Kes 20,000 successfully.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for the maintenance of the her motorcycle (gasoline, tune ups, oil change, and motor parts)

loans.name: Marilia

texts.es:
Marilia de 22 años de edad , esta casada con Rubén de 30 años y con quien tiene una hija de 2 años respectivamente .Posee una vivienda construida a base de adobe construido poco después de su casamiento. Marilia se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles ,con el paso de los primeros meses noto que era muy rentable y esta fue la escusa perfecta para ampliar su negocio ubicado en un ambiente acogedor del primer piso de su vivienda con andamos mas grandes.
El principal inconveniente que presenta su normal desempeño es el traslado de su mercadería desde el distrito principal hasta su localidad puesto que las vías de acceso no son constantemente mantenidas incrementándose el precio por el concepto del transporte en más de una ocasión.
Espera seguir adelante con su negocio hasta ampliarlo de manera considerable y cumplir a su vez uno de sus grandes objetivos que es la construcción de su vivienda a base de ladrillos y cemento.
Este es su primer crédito con Kiva el cual la hace sentir mas confiada esperando desde ya cumplir de manera puntual con el pago de sus cuotas .
Requiere para esta primera ocasión contar con S/.2,000 nuevos soles y abastecer a su negocio con bebidas gasificadas ,, galletas, arroz, azúcar, leche y cereales los cuales presentan muy buena demanda por parte de sus vecinos.
texts.en: Marilia is 22 years old and his married to Rubén, who is 30. Together they have a 2-year-old daughter. They own an adobe home that was built shortly after they were married. Marilia has a business selling groceries. After the first few months, she noticed that it was very profitable, and this was the perfect excuse to expand her business into a comfortable and more spacious room on the first floor of her home. The main difficulty in the course of her normal work is the transportation of her merchandise from the city center to her home. The local roads are not well-maintained, which has led to increases in the cost of transportation on more than one occasion. She hopes to continue growing her business considerably and at the same time hopes to achieve one of her main goals, which is to build a home of concrete and bricks. This is her first loan with Kiva. She is very confident that she will be able to complete her repayments in a punctual manner. She is currently seeking a loan of 2,000 nuevos soles in order to stock her business with carbonated beverages, cookies, rice, sugar, milk and cereal, since these are the items which in most in demand from her neighbors.

loans.use: to buy products such as rice, sugar, milk, beverages and more.

loans.name: Jivan

texts.ru:
Дживан родился 1961г. в городе Каджаране. .После школы окончил Капанский  Политехнический институт по специальности  инженер горняк. И Дживана  три дочери и сын. Старшей дочери 23 лет учится на третьем  курсе Ереванского медицинского университета на лечебном факультете . Средней дочери 20 лет учится на втором курсе Капанского  Политехнического института на финансово-экономическом факультете . А младшей дочери Дживана 19 лет ,она учится на втором  курсе Ереванского медицинского университета на лечебном факультете .Жена Дживана домохозяйка . 
С 1997года  Дживан занимается на своей территории предпринимательской деятельностью изготовлением кузова для грузовых автомобилей, имеет собственное оборудование, подъемный автокран, погрузочную машину. 
Дживану нужен кредит на сумму  900.000 Армянских драм для оплаты за обучение своих дочерей за  семестр.
texts.en:
Jivan was born in 1961 in the town of Kadjaran. After high school, he graduated from Kapan Polytechnic Institute with a specialty in mining engineering. Jivan has three daughters and a son. 

The eldest daughter is 23 and is studying in the third year at Yerevan Medical University in the therapeutic department. The middle daughter is 20 and is studying in the second year at Kapan Polytechnic Institute in the finance-economics department. Jivan's youngest daughter is 19 and is studying in the second year at Yerevan Medical University in the therapeutic department. Jivan's wife is a homemaker. 

Since 1997, Jivan has been engaged in his own territory in the business of manufacturing commercial vehicle bodies, and he has his own equipment, a lifting crane, and a loading machine.

Jivan needs a loan of 900,000 Armenian drams to pay for the education of his daughters for a semester.

loans.use: to pay his daughters' tuition fees

loans.name: Inuka Group

texts.en:
David is pictured on the right with his hand raised amongst his Inuka Group members. The 10 of them, 6 women and 4 men, are farmers in the Chwele District. Farming inputs will be delivered to him on credit consisting of the necessary materials to plant a ½ acre of millet, sweet potatoes and sorghum. David joined One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2010 season, and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2013 season. David joined One Acre Fund so that he could be assured of reliable input delivery and gain access to hybrid seeds and fertilizer.

Prior to joining One Acre Fund, David was only able to harvest 3 bags of maize per ½ acre, but after joining One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2012 season, he was able to harvest 12 bags per ½ acre! He plans on using future profits from the harvest to invest in livestock and grow enough food for his family. David’s group members will each receive input loans of ½ acre during the 2013 Long Rains season. In total they will receive inputs for 5 acres of millet, sweet potatoes and sorghum.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of millet, sweet potatoes, and sorghum.

loans.name: Genesis Group

texts.en:
Patrick is pictured on the right with his hand raised amongst his Genesis Group members. The 11 of them, eight women and three men, are farmers in Chwele District. Farming inputs, consisting of the necessary inputs to plant a half acre of millet, sweet potatoes and sorghum, will be delivered to Patrick on credit. Patrick first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2009 Long Rains and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access the best input prices and use additional profits to pay for the loan.

Patrick reports that before One Acre Fund, he was able to grow about six bags of maize per half acre, but with his One Acre Fund input loan during Long Rains 2012, he harvested 20 bags per half acre! He hopes that his profits from the 2013 Long Rains season can be used to send his children to school and to buy a new cow. During the 2013 Long Rains season, each group member will receive a half acre of agricultural inputs on credit. In all, Patrick's group will receive 5.5 acres worth of inputs on credit.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of millet, sweet potatoes, and sorghum.

loans.name: Antipa

texts.en:
Antipa is a 30-year-old, married man. He has two children, ages 3 and 6 years. He describes himself as an honest and warm man. He operates a shop, where he provides welding services. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located at a competitive business area, and his primary customers are local residents.

He says that his biggest business challenge is insufficient funds for improving the business. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy metal, for welding services. His business goal is to run a welding store in his town within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy metal for welding

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy animal feed, vaccines, and supplements for her pigs

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah is a 50-year-old woman, blessed with four children. 

She is determined, jovial, and committed to her daily business activity of running a farming business and a grocery store, which has been in operation for ten years.  Previously, she took a loan of KES 40,000 and managed to restock her store with vegetables. 

Leah has a plan of expanding her business and paying school fees for her children with profits which will be generated from the business. Therefore, she requested a loan of KES 40,000 which will be used to buy vegetable seeds for planting.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds for planting.

loans.name: Amani

texts.en:
Amani is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in her Kiva profile photo. 
Amani is a 25-year-old young woman. She lives with her husband in Jabalia. Her husband is employed and earns a small salary, but it is not enough to cover the family's needs. Amani is a university student who wants to complete her studies, so she is requesting a USD loan from FATEN to help her cover the cost of purchasing a new laptop. This will help Amani do her homework and reports.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for her studies

loans.name: Njeete Group

texts.en:
Njeete is a group of five farmers in Chwele District represented by Violet. The group has five women. Violet is on the right of the photo with her hand raised. Farming inputs, consisting of the necessary materials to plant a half acre of millet, sweet potatoes and sorghum, will be delivered to her on credit. The 2013 Long Rains season will be Violet’s first season with One Acre Fund. She joined this year in order to gain access to hybrid seed and fertilizer and use increased profits to send her children to school.

Violet managed to harvest six bags of maize on a half acre of land last year. As a One Acre Fund farmer, she hopes to harvest even more! She plans on using future profits from the harvest to send her children to school and to repair her home. During the 2013 Long Rains season, each group member will receive half an acre of agricultural inputs on credit. In all, Violet’s group will receive 2.5 acres worth of inputs on credit.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of millet, sweet potatoes and sorghum.

loans.name: Phillip

texts.en: Phillip is a 31-year-old married man. He has one child. He describes himself as a hard working and determined man. He operates a repair service and retail business where he provides vehicle repair service and sells oil. He has been involved in this business for one year. His business is located in a densely populated area, and his primary customers are motor vehicle owners. Phillip says his biggest business challenge is the high price of oil. He will use the 10,000 KES loan to buy oil for the motor vehicles. His goal is to expand his business and create job opportunities for employees within five years.

loans.use: to buy oil for his motor vehicle repair service

loans.name: Salomat

texts.ru:
Саломат жительница города Исфара. Ей 50 лет. Она замужем. У нее двое детей. Образование у Саломат среднее. Саломат трудолюбивая и добрая женщина. 
Саломат на протяжении семи лет занимается торговлей. Сейчас она арендует торговую точку на рынке. Саломат занимается торговлей фруктов. 
Саломат берет кредит для покупки фруктов, чтобы увеличить оборот.
texts.en: Salomat is a resident of Isfara, Tajikistan.  She is 50 years old, married and she has two children.  She holds a high school diploma.  Salomat is a hardworking and kind woman.  For seven years, she has been engaged in trade.  Now, she rents a space at a market where she sells fruits.  Salomat is taking out a loan to buy fruits to increase her turn over.

loans.use: to buy apples, pears, bananas, pomegranates and grapes which will increase turnover

loans.name: Cornelio

texts.en:
Cornelio is a 40-year-old, married man, and the father of nine children. He has been engaged in a fishing business for more than 25 years. This is the source of his income.

Cornelio is asking for a loan, which he will use to buy fishing nets, lead weights, fish hooks, and fuel for the boat. With this, Cornelio will be able to improve his fishing business, augmenting his catch and income. In the future, Cornelio has high hopes of making his business a success and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, lead weights, fish hooks and fuel for the boat

loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
Omar is a 21-year-old young man. He lives with his family in a small village near Tulkarem. He has a small project which is a public services office for school and university students. This project is a somewhat profitable project but needs some improvements, such as purchasing a new copying machine and other machines for his office.
Omar has requested a USD youth loan from FATEN. This loan will help Omar raise his income by buying some necessary machines. 
Omar appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new copying machine for his services office

loans.name: Yousef

texts.en:
Yousef is a 25-year-old young man. He lives with his wife in a small village near Tubas. He has a small business project, which is a bookstore for stationery and students' needs. Yousef's project is located near several schools in his village. 

Yousef needs to improve his project by buying more stock for his library. He is requesting a youth loan from FATEN to help him cover the cost of purchasing more stationery to sell. This loan will help Yousef to improve his income.

Yousef appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy stationery to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a food warmer and supplies.

loans.name: Bubusaira

texts.ru: Бубусара 64, замужем. Бубусара по характеру очень хороший человек. Имеет хорошие отзывы от соседей. Они её любят и поддерживают. Бубусара в качестве источника дохода для своей семьи 20 лет назад начала заниматься полеводством и животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы в 18,000 KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Бубусара в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 1 корова, 1 бычок, 1 лошадь и 20 голов овец, ежемесячная прибыль от хозяйства составляет около 6,000 сом (KGS) от продажи молока и молочных продуктов и дополнительно от полеводства. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Бубусара обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) подготовку к весенне полевым работам. Доходы от кредита Бубусара планирует вкладывать в развитие бизнеса посредством покупки дополнительных голов скота.
texts.en:
Bubusara is 64 and married. Bubusara is a good person. She has good reviews from her neighbors. They love and support her. As a source of income for her family, Bubusara began 20 years ago to engage in agriculture and livestock, starting with a sum of 18,000 KGS. 

Through hard work, Bubusara today has on her farm one cow, one calf, one horse, and 20 sheep. Monthly income from the farm is about 6,000 som (KGS) from the sale of milk and dairy products and additionally from agriculture. 

In order to further develop her business, Bubusara turned to Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to prepare for the spring field work. Bubusara plans to invest income from the loan in the business through the purchase of additional heads of cattle.

loans.use: to prepare for spring field work

loans.name: Ndunge

texts.en: Ndunge is married and has children who attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Ndunge works every day, selling grains, vegetables, and garden produce in the streets. She lacks a stall of her own, where she could sell her products. Ndunge has done this for more than five years. Her new loan will be invested in purchasing vegetables and garden produce to continue her business. Ndunge's goal is to have her own stall, where she can sell her products in a better manner.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and garden produce to continue her business.

loans.name: Luciana

texts.en: Luciana is applying for a loan of $600 from TRM (Tuba Rai Metin). She is 32 years old. She is runs a kiosk in her house, and she will use the loan to buy cold sweat ice cream, a refrigerator, and bread for her store. She is making good money from the business, and she wants to apply for a bigger loan in the future. Luciana lives in a town near the school; her kiosk is located in a strategic place where many people, including students, come to make purchases.

loans.use: to buy cold sweat ice cream, a refrigerator and bread for her home-based business.

loans.name: Faulu Group

texts.en: Faulu Group is a group of 11 farmers in Teso District represented by Merensiana. The group is composed of seven women and four men. Merensiana is on the right of the photo with her hand raised. Farming inputs will be delivered to her on credit, consisting of the necessary materials to plant a half-acre of millet, sweet potatoes and sorghum. The 2013 Long Rains season will be Merensiana’s first season with One Acre Fund. She joined this year in order to gain access to hybrid seed and fertilizer and to grow enough to feed her family. Merensiana described her harvest last year as good. She hopes that, as a One Acre Fund farmer, she will be able to join the ranks of the One Acre Fund farmers who have doubled their harvests in their first year with the program. She plans on using the future profits from the harvest to send her children to school and perhaps to invest in another business. During the 2013 Long Rains season, each group member will receive a half-acre of agricultural inputs on credit. Merensiana’s group will receive a total of 5.5 acres worth of inputs on credit. The field officer is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of millet, sweet potatoes, and sorghum.

loans.name: Baraka Group

texts.en:
Fidelis’ group has 12 farmers and is located in the Teso District. Fidelis is pictured on the right of Baraka Group with her hand raised. Fidelis is pictured amongst the 3 men and 9 women of her group. She will receive input loans capable of planting ½ an acre with sorghum, sweet potatoes and millet. Fidelis joined One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2012, and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2013 season. Fidelis joined One Acre Fund so that she could be assured of reliable input delivery and access to the best input prices.

Fidelis reports that before One Acre Fund, she was able to grow about 2 bags of maize per ½ acre, but with her One Acre Fund input loan during Long Rains 2012, she harvested 9 bags per ½ acre! She hopes that her profits from the 2013 Long Rains season can be used to send her children to school and to invest in a new cow. For the 2013 Long Rains season, Fidelis’ group members will take input loans of ½ acre each. In total, this group will receive input loans for use on 6 acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of millet, sweet potatoes and sorghum.

loans.name: Shahnoza

texts.ru:
Шахноза жительница города Исфара. Ей 26 лет. Она замужем. Шахноза живет с родителями и мужем. В семье их девять человек. У Шахнозы пятеро детей, двое сыновей и трое девочек. Ее дети маленькие. Шахноза трудолюбивая и хорошая домохозяйка. Она с детства занимается шитьем. Шахноза очень любит шить. На сегодняшний день у нее имеется собственная швейная машинка. Своя отдельная комната, где она проводит свое свободное время. Шахноза вот уже сем лет шьет платья себе и своим родным. Кроме того она шьет шторы и занавески для своего дома. Шахноза с большим желанием шьет платья и шторы, а также она шьет матрасы (курпача). 
Шахноза обратилась в Хумо за кредитом для покупки тканей и материалов, чтобы начать предоставлять свои услуги населению города. Она знает, что таким образом она сможет заняться своим любимым делом и получать доход, который очень поможет ее семье. Она сможет провести ремонт в доме и в будущем улучшить условия проживания. Шахноза благодарит всех Вас, она надеется на Вашу поддержку!
texts.en: Shahnoza is a resident of Isfara.  She is 26 years old and married.  She lives with her parents and husband.  There are 8 people in her family.  She has 5 young children: 2 sons and 3 daughters. Shahnoza is hardworking and a good homemaker.  She has sewed since her childhood and she loves to do it very much.  Today, she owns her own sewing machine, and has a separate room where she spends her free time.  Shahnoza has been sewing dresses for herself and her relatives for 7 years already.  She also sews drapes and curtains for her home.  She has a great passion for sewing dresses and drapes and even sews mattresses.  Shahnoza has turned to Humo for a loan to buy fabrics and materials in order to begin offering her services to those living in her city.  She knows that through this method, she can turn one of her favorite hobbies into a job, the income from which will really help her family.  She will be able to pay to make repairs to her home in the future which will improve her family's living conditions.  Shahnoza is grateful to all of you and she hopes for your support!

loans.use: To buy fabrics and materials.

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina is a 43-year-old married woman and the mother nine children from Talibon, Bohol. She is engaged in the selling of seafood products like sea cucumber, oyster and others. She also runs a sari-sari (convenience) store.

Divina is a member of CEVI, a microfinance in the Philippines. Divina works hard in order to provide support to her husband in meeting the needs of the family, especially for the schooling of her children.

With a loan, Divina will be able to buy more stock for her store like canned goods, candies, rice, soap, toiletries, sea cucumber and other seafood. In the future, Divina hopes to make her business a success and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her store like canned goods, candies, rice, soap, toiletries, sea cucumber and other seafood

loans.name: Aigul

texts.ru: Айгул 46 лет, замужем, воспитывает 2 детей. Айгул в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, в течении 17 лет, начала заниматься животноводством и полеводством, стартовав с 17,000 KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Айгул, ее деятельность позволяет приносить около 7,800 сом в месяц, что служит основой для покрытия расходов на питание и бытовые нужды семьи. Доходы от бизнеса позволили Айгул увеличить деятельность за счет сельского хозяйства, в частности животноводства - ее хозяйство насчитывает 3 КРС, 2 телят и 12 овец. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Айгул обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на закуп скота. Доходы от кредита Айгул планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего бизнеса, часть доходов планирует направить на приобретение автомобиля.
texts.en:
Aigul is 46 years old, married, and is raising two children. As a source of income for the family, Aigul over the course of 17 year began to engage in livestock and agriculture, starting with 17,000 KGS. 

Through Aigul's hard work, her activities bring in about 7,800 som per month, which is the basis for covering the costs of food and household needs for the family. Income from the business allowed Aigul to expand activities of agriculture and especially livestock - her farm consists of three cattle, two calves, and 12 sheep. 

In order to further develop her business, Aigul turned to Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to purchase livestock. Aigul plans to invest income from the loan to further expand her business, and also plans to use part of the proceeds to purchase a car.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en: Caroline is a 35-year-old married woman. She has five children. She describes herself as a risk taker and a warm woman. She operates a clothes retail business. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in an urban area, and her primary customers are local customers and walk-ins. She says her biggest business challenge is insufficient funds for improving the business. She will use the 50,000 KES loan to purchase clothes to sell. Her business goal is to expand her business within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM after she managed to pay a previous loan of 35,000 KES successfully.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is a 25-year-old single woman. She describes herself as an ambitious woman. She operates a retail store where she provides printing services. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a viable business area, and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high prices of stationery used in printing. She will use the KES 60,000 loan to purchase a printing machine, which will assist to increase her deliveries of printing services. Her business goal is to expand her business within five years. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM. She managed to repay a previous loan of KES 40,000 successfully.

loans.use: to purchase a printer for use in her business.

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.en: Cresencia earns a living through her sari-sari or variety store business, selling various goods and items to the people in her neighborhood in Getafe, Bohol. She is a married woman and the mother of four children. Cresencia dreams of expanding her business so that she will be able to cater to more buyers, but she lacks the capital to do so. For this reason, she joined CEVI, a microfinance institution in the Philippines that offers small entrepreneurs loans for their businesses. With a loan, Cresencia will be able to buy more stocks to sell, including canned goods, candies, soap and detergents, rice, cooking seasonings and soda.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell in her sari-sari (variety) store, including canned goods, candies, soap and detergents, rice, cooking seasonings and soda.

loans.name: Merla

texts.en:
Merla is a 48-year-old married woman and the mother of five children from Getafe, Bohol. She has been engaged in a fishing business for more than 7 years now with her husband. This is the source of their income.

Merla is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and buckets. With this they will be able to improve their fishing business as well as their income. In the future, Merla hopes of making her business a success.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and buckets

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.en:
Rogelio runs a sari-sari or variety store business. He lives with his family in Talibon, Bohol.

He is asking for a loan to buy additional stock to sell like canned goods, candies, soap, toiletries, chips, biscuits and snack foods. With this he will be able to attract and cater to more buyers in his store thus augmenting his sales and income.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell like canned goods, candies, soap, toiletries, chips, biscuits and snack foods

loans.name: Orozgul

texts.ru: Орозгул 43 года, замужем, имеет 3 детей. Орозгул после замужества начала заниматься животноводством и садоводством, стартовав с 5,000 KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Орозгул, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 10 овец и 4 коров, приносящее около 15,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Орозгул обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота на откорм. Доходы от кредита Орозгул планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства.
texts.en: Orozgul is 43 years old, married and has three children.  After marrying her husband, she began working in agriculture and livestock, starting her business with 5,000 KGS.  Thanks to her hard work, Orozgul today has 10 sheep and 4 cows which bring in around 15,000 KGS each month.  With the goal of further developing her business, Orozgul has turned to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan of 80,000 KGS to buy cattle and fodder.  The income from the loan will be used to further expand her business activities.

loans.use: To purchase more cattle

loans.name: Zumrad

texts.ru: Зумрад 25 лет, замужем, мать 1 дочки. Зумрад в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, на протяжении 7 лет занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы 6,000 KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Зумрад в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 1 корова с приплодом и 2 овцы, продажа молока и молочных продуктов приносит около 15,000 сом в месяц. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Зумрад обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 1 коровы с теленком и овец. Доходы от кредита Зумрад планирует вложить в ремонт дома.
texts.en: Zumrad is 25 years old, married and the mother of one daughter.  She is the main source of income for her family and has worked with livestock for the past 7 years.  She began her business with only 6,000 KGS.  Thanks to her hard work, Zumrad today has under her care 1 cow with calf and 2 sheep.  She brings in around 15,000 KGS each month from the sale of milk and dairy prodcuts.  With the goal of further developing her business, Zumrad has turned to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan of 120,000 KGS to buy 1 cow with calf and sheep.  The income from the loan will be used to make repairs to her home.

loans.use: To purchase 1 cow with calf and sheep

loans.name: Malikekhan

texts.ru:
Маликехан 1966 года рождения, не замужем, воспитывает двоих детей. 
	Видя подрастающих детей, Маликехан  решила найти пути обеспечения достойного будущего для них. Уже более 10 лет занимается торговляй одежды на рынке. 
Маликехан Кимсановна в осносном занимается торговлей, в бизнесе помогает сестра заемщика.  Девиз жизни Маликехан: «Не оглядываться назад, а смотреть только вперед!».
В данный момент Маликехан планирует еще увеличить товарооборот. Она привлекает клиентов своим энтузиазмом, оптимизмом, жизнерадостностью. 
	Желание не останавливаться на достигнутом привело Маликехан  в  банк «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в размере 120,000 KGS увеличения ассортимента летних вещей для продажи. За период нашей работы она зарекомендовала себя как активным, предприимчивым, ответственным и трудолюбивым человеком. 
Маликехан Кимсановна является боговерующим человеком, ее отзывчивость, честность не вызывает сомнений.
texts.en:
Malikekhan was born in 1966, is not married, and is raising two children. 

Seeing the children growing, Malikekhan decided to find ways to ensure a decent future for them. For more than ten years, she has been engaged in selling clothes at the market. Malikekhan is mainly involved in trade, and is helped in the business by her sister. The life motto of Malikekhan: "Don't look back, and look only forward!"

Currently, Malikekhan plans to increase turnover. She attracts customers with her enthusiasm, optimism, and cheerfulness. Her desire not to stop led Malikekhan to the bank Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan of 120,000 KGS to increase her assortment of summer clothes for sale. 

During the period of our work, she has established herself as an active, enterprising, responsible, and hardworking person. Malikekhan is a God believing person, her compassion and her honesty are not in doubt.

loans.use: to purchase summer clothes for resale

loans.name: Atamakin Group

texts.en:
Atamakin is a group of 18 farmers in Teso District represented by Humphrey. The group has ten women and eight men. Humphrey is on the right of the photo with his hand raised. Farming inputs, consisting of the necessary materials to plant a half acre of millet, sweet potatoes and sorghum, will be delivered to him on credit. The 2013 Long Rains season will be Humphrey’s first season with One Acre Fund. He joined this year in order to gain access to hybrid seed and fertilizer and use increased profits to send his children to school.

Humphrey managed to harvest nine bags of maize on one acre of land last year. As a One Acre Fund farmer, he hopes to harvest even more! He plans on using future profits from the harvest to send his children to school and to invest in a new cow. During the 2013 Long Rains season, each group member will receive half an acre of agricultural inputs on credit. Humphrey’s group will receive nine acres worth of inputs on credit.

The field officer is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of millet, sweet potatoes and sorghum.

loans.name: Akiyuun Group

texts.en:
James is a member of Akiyuun Group in Teso District. He is pictured as one of 18 One Acre Fund farmers, 5 women and 13 men. James is standing on the right with his hand raised. He is receiving an input loan for a ½ acre of millet, sweet potatoes and sorghum cultivation.

James is a new One Acre Fund farmer and is excited for the 2013 Long Rains season. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access the best input prices and grow enough food for the family.

James described his harvest last year as poor. He hopes as a One Acre Fund farmer that he is able to join the ranks of One Acre Fund farmers that have doubled their harvest in their first year of the program. He hopes that his profits from the 2013 Long Rains season can be used to send his children to school and save for the future.

For the 2013 Long Rains season, James' group members will take input loans for a ½ acre each. In total, this group will receive input loans for use on 9 acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of millet, sweet potatoes and sorghum

loans.name: Susana

texts.en: Susana has been engaged in a food vending business for more than two years now. She lives with her husband and children in Talibon, Bohol. Her husband works as a fisherman. Susana is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights and other items. With this, her husband will be able to improve his catch, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market. In the future, Susana hopes to make her business successful and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights and others

loans.name: Tumenjargal

texts.en:
Tumenjargal is a 30-year-old, female, head of the family. She lives with her son and parents in Ger, in the Amgalan area of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. Her parents are retired and stay home taking care of her son Soronzonbold, age 4. They also help her to run her business of organic dairy products sales. 

Tumenjargal has been running her organic dairy products sales business in a local market since 2011. She has gained lot of experience since then. She is now requesting  a loan of MNT 2,000,000 to purchase a large amount of organic dairy products to sell at her rental counter. She is a hard-working and diligent woman.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of organic dairy products to sell at her rental counter.

loans.name: Buajar

texts.ru: Буажар 55 лет, двова, имеет 3 детей. На сегодняшний день младший сын проживает вместе с ней. Буажар в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, на протяжении 20 лет занимается животноводством и полеводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы в 10,000 сом. Благодаря упорному труду Буажар в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 2 коровы с приплодом, продажа молока приносит около 15,000 сом в месяц. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Буажар обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 75,000 сом (KGS) на подготовку к весенне полевым работам. Доходы от кредита Буажар будет вкладывать в дальнейшее развитие бизнеса.
texts.en: Buajar is 55 years old, a widow, and has 3 children.  Her youngest son currently lives with her.  She is the main source of income for her family.  For the past 20 years, she has worked in agriculture and livestock, having started her business with 10,000 KGS.  Thanks to her hard work, Buajar today has 2 cows, each with a calf.  The sale of milk brings in around 15,000 KGS each month.  With the goal of further developing her business, Buajar has turned to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan of 75,000 KGS to prepare for spring field work.  The income from the loan will be saved for future business expansion.

loans.use: To prepare for spring field work

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase farming equipment

loans.name: Urazgul

texts.ru: Уразгуль незамужняя молодая девушка. Ей 23 года. Она живет с родителями в районе Кубадиён в южной части Таджикистана. Отец Уразгуль в данное время находится на заработках в загранице. Уразуль самостоятельная и независимая девушка. Она с 20 лет занимается растениеводством и уже три года как трудится в этой сфере. Сейчас она берет кредит для посева арбуза. Полученный кредит она использует для приобретения семян арбуза, минеральных удобрений, топлива и для оплаты тракториста. За счет прибыли с урожая, Уразгуль планирует сделать ремонт в доме.
texts.en:
Urazgul is an unmarried young woman. She is 23 years old. She lives with her parents in the Qubadiyon region in the southern part of Tajikistan. Urazgul's father is currently working abroad. 

Urazgul is a self-sufficient and independent girl. She has 20 years experience in agriculture and three years of work in this field. Now, she is taking a loan for planting watermelons. She will use the loan to purchase watermelon seeds, mineral fertilizers, fuel, and to pay the tractor driver. 

Urazgul plans to use profit from the harvest to redecorate her home.

loans.use: to purchase watermelon seeds, mineral fertilizers, fuel, and to pay the tractor driver

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita has run a sari-sari, or variety store business in her place for more than 8 years now. She lives with her family in Talibon, Bohol. Teresita is asking for a loan to buy additional stock to sell like canned goods, candies, soap, toiletries. rice, chips and biscuits. With this, she will be able to attract and cater to more buyers in her store, thus increasing her sales and income. In the future, Teresita hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell like canned goods, candies, soap, toiletries, rice, chips and biscuits

loans.name: Nazgul

texts.ru: Назгул  40 лет, замужем, воспитывает 5 детей. В качестве источника дохода для семьи, Назгул занимается животноводством и растениеводством в течении 17 лет. Имея в хозяйстве 12 коров и 2 бычка, Назгул имеет ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 17,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Назгул обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительных голов крупного рогатого скота. Доходы Назгул планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего хозяйства.
texts.en: Nazgul is 40 years old, married, and is raising 5 children.  She is the main source of income for her family.  Nazgul has worked with agriculture and livestock for 17 years.  She has 12 cows and 2 bulls that bring in a monthly income of 17,000 KGS.  With the goal of further developing her business, Nazgul has turned to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan of 30,000 KGS to buy additional livestock.  She plans to use the income from the loan to increase her herd even further.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Emma

texts.ru:
Эмма -  женщина фермер.  С 1981 года занимается выращиванием бахчевых культур, таких как дыня и арбуз.
Справляться по хозяйству ей помогает муж и двое детей 25-ти и 29-ти лет.
Развитие деятельности начиналось с посадки лука  в открытом грунте.
Эмма решила приобрести систему капельного орошения  для полива своего участка.
В планах на будущее:  расширить посевные площади бахчевых культур, купить навесное оборудование для трактора.
В личных планах: достроить жилой дом.
Нуждается в вашей помощи для финансирования системы капельного орошения.
texts.en:
Emma is a woman farmer. Since 1981, she has been engaged in raising melons, such as cantaloupe and watermelon. To manage the farm, she is helped by her husband and two children, who are 25 and 29 years old. Development activities began with planting onions in the open field. 

Emma decided to purchase a drip irrigation system for watering her plot. 

Future Plans: to expand cultivated areas for melons and to buy tractor attachments.
Personal Plans: to finish the house. 

She needs help to finance the irrigation system.

loans.use: to purchase farming equipment

loans.name: Alexandr

texts.ru:
Александр - фермер. С 1993 года занимается выращиванием дыни, арбуза, кукурузы и огурцов.
Справляться по хозяйству ему помогает супруга и двое детей 16-ти и 24-х лет.
Развитие деятельности начиналось с посадки лука в открытом грунте.
Александр  решил приобрести систему капельного орошения для полива и агроволокно.
В планах на будущее:  приобрести дизельную помпу для полива.
В личных планах: Приобрести автомобиль для транспортировки товара на рынок.
Нуждается в вашей помощи для финансирования системы капельного орошения и агроволокна.
texts.en:
Alexandr is a farmer. Since 1993, he has been engaged in growing cantaloupe, watermelon, corn, and cucumbers. To manage the farm, he is helped by his wife and two children, aged 16 and 24. Development activities began with planting onions in the open field. Alexandr decided to purchase a drip irrigation system for watering and aquaculture. 

Future Plans: to purchase a diesel pump for irrigation. 
Personal Plans: to purchase a car for transporting goods to market. 

He needs help to finance the drip irrigation system and aquaculture.

loans.use: to purchase farming equipment

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.ru: Людмила занимается выращиванием овощей на своем участке с Водяное уже 9 лет. Выращивает помидоры, огурцы, редис. Муж Людмилы раньше сильно выпивал и они развелись. Он пожил сам, ничего не получилось и вернулся в семью. Людмила простила мужа и теперь снова живут и работают вместе. Людмила решила расширяться бизнес и построить еще одну теплицу. Своих денег немного не хватает, поэтому Людмила просит предоставтиь кредит 7,000 гриен на материалы для постройки новой теплицы.
texts.en:
Ludmila is engaged in growing vegetables on her plot near Vodyanoye for nine years. She grows tomatoes, cucumbers, and radishes. Ludmila's husband  used to drink heavily, and they divorced. He lived alone, did not work, and returned to the family. Ludmila forgave her husband and now they live and work together again. 

Ludmila decided to expand the business and build another greenhouse. Money is a little short, so Ludmila is asking for a loan of 7,000 hryvnia for materials to build a new greenhouse.

loans.use: to build a new greenhouse

loans.name: Usiangalie Group

texts.en:
Daniel is a member of Usiangalie Group, in Teso District. This picture shows the 10 One Acre Fund farmers, four women and six men, who are members of the group. (The field officer is standing on the left of the photo.) Daniel is standing on the right, with his hand raised. He is receiving an input loan for ½ acre of millet, sweet potato and sorghum cultivation. Daniel is a new One Acre Fund farmer and is excited for the 2013 Long Rains season. He joined One Acre Fund in order to gain access to hybrid seed and fertilizer, and to grow enough food for the family.

Daniel described his harvest last year as good. He hopes that as a One Acre Fund farmer, he will be able to join the ranks of One Acre Fund farmers who have doubled their harvest in their first year of the program. He hopes that his profits from the 2013 Long Rains season can be used to send his children to school and repair his home. For the 2013 Long Rains season, Usiangalie Group members will take input loans of ½ acre each. In total, this group will receive input loans for use on five acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of millet, sweet potatoes, and sorghum.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is 39 years old, and she is married. She has a sales kiosk, to generate income for her family. She has been thinking about how to run a big business, but she does not have enough working capital. She felt better when she applied for her first loan, and now she is applying for her second loan of $1,000. She will use the loan to buy some additional supplies to keep in her store, such as soft drinks, hard drinks, body lotion and biscuits. She is happy with TRM (Tuba Rai Metin), which offers loans to poor people.

loans.use: to buy inventory for her kiosk, i.e., items such as soft drinks, hard drinks, body lotion and biscuits

loans.name: Lilya

texts.ru: Лилия занимается выращиванием ранних овощей уже 4 года. В основном выращивает помидоры и картофель. Ранние помидоры выращивает в теплицах, поздние и картофель - в открытом грунте. Сейчас Лилия готовится к сезону - делает мелкий ремонт теплицы, закупает удобрения и посадочный материал. Лилия просит предоставить ей кредит в размере 6 тыс. гривен. Она надеется получит хорошую прибыль, благодаря которой сможет восполнять нужды своей семьи.
texts.en:
Lilya has been engaged in growing early vegetables for four years. She mostly grows tomatoes and potatoes. Early tomatoes grow in a greenhouse, and later potatoes grow in an open field. 

Now, Lilya is preparing for the season - making minor greenhouse repairs, buying fertilizer and planting material. 

Lilya is asking for a loan of six thousand hryvnia. She hopes to earn a good profit, and through it she will be able to fulfill the needs of her family.

loans.use: to make repairs on the greenhouse and to buy fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more items to sell in his store, like canned goods, snacks, and drinks

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is married and has four school-going children. She owns a house with electricity and piped water, but her greatest monthly expense is food. 

Elizabeth is a very hardworking person who thanks her efforts for getting ahead and helping her family day by day. She tells us that things are very difficult, but in spite of that she makes an effort to move forward.

She is asking for this loan of KES 15,000 in order to buy five bags of potatoes, tomatoes, onions and vegetables. In this way, she will be able to continue working and having sales that will give her the income to maintain her home.

loans.use: to buy five bags of potatoes, tomatoes, onions and vegetables.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is 38 years old and married. Her marriage has borne her four children, three of whom attend school. 

Veronica has kept her whole family going thanks to her hard work and dedication. She had planted maize, potatoes and vegetable crops. At this time, she is hoping with this loan to replant and increase her produce.

She will use this loan to buy seeds and fertilizers and to pay for farmhands during the planting. This is Veronica’s second loan cycle with Yehu Microfinance, and she likes it because the loans have helped her a lot. Her dream is to continue to make progress.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers, and to pay for farmhands during the planting.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more items to sell, including canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 31-year-old Lebanese single man. He lives with his parents. He strives to work really hard, since he’s the one responsible for covering the family expenses.  

After many years of experience as a carpenter, Ali decided to open his own carpentry business. He’s a reputable person who has gained a fair number of loyal customers so far. He works independently, and looks forward to gaining added projects. 

Today, Ali is in need of a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to purchase the needed quantity of wood for his work. He also wants to buy new tools and materials. He notes that this will improve his business, thus boost his productivity.

loans.use: to purchase the needed quantity of wood for his work.

loans.name: Wedinya Group

texts.en:
Wedinya is a group of 10 farmers in Teso District, represented by Elizabeth. The group has six women and four men. Elizabeth is on the right of the photo, with her hand raised. Farming inputs will be delivered to her on credit, consisting of the necessary materials to plant ½ acre of millet, sweet potatoes and sorghum. The 2013 Long Rains season will be Elizabeth’s first season with One Acre Fund. She joined this year in order to gain access to hybrid seed and fertilizer, and to use her increased profits to send her children to school.

Elizabeth thought her harvest last year was good. She hopes that as a One Acre Fund farmer, she can have an excellent harvest. She plans on using future profits from the harvest to send her children to school and buy a pig. During the 2013 Long Rains season, each group member will receive ½ an acre of agricultural inputs, on credit. Wedinya Group will receive 5 acres' worth of inputs, on credit.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of millet, sweet potatoes, and sorghum.

loans.name: Akram

texts.ru: Акрам трудолюбивый и целеустремленный молодой человек. Он живет вместе с семьей в большом городе, где прогресс ускоряется день изо дня. Он живет вместе с мамой, женой и детьми. Он воспитывает 2 сыновей. Жена Акрама домохозяйка и занимается воспитанием детей. Его мать работает уборщицей в гостинице. Акрам работает в строительной организации. Он любит свою работу и справляется своей работой отлично. Он является одним из лучших строитель - мастеров. Зарплата Акрама и его матери не хватает для обеспечения семьи. Он хочет организовать свой новый бизнес услугой такси. Он надеется, что его бизнес будет развиваться и принести много дохода, так как он живет в столице и там много народа, которые используют такси. Он будет справляться с бизнесом один. Он запрашивает займ в сумме 3000 Сомони для покупки автомашины. Он надеется на вашу доброту.
