texts.en: Akram is a hardworking and ambitious young man.  He lives with his family in a big city where progress is accelerating every day.  He lives with his mom, his wife and his children.  He has 2 sons.  His wife is a homemaker and raises the children.  His mother works as a maid in a hotel.  Akram works at a construction company.  He loves his work and takes pride in a job well done.  He's one of the more skilled masters of construction.  His and his mother's income isn't enough to provide for the family.  They want to organize their own new taxi business.  He hopes that this business will grow and come to bring in much income since he lives in the capital where there is a large population that uses taxis.  He will work this business himself.  He's asking for a loan of 3,000 KGS to buy an automobile.  He hopes for your kind support.

loans.use: To buy a car

loans.name: Layale

texts.en:
Layale is a 31-year-old, Lebanese, married woman. She’s living with her husband and two children, the children attending school. She cooperates with her husband and has started to work very early, hoping she could bring added income to the family. She has been working as a beautician since 2005, and she has customers from all over the neighboring area. She also visits them at their places.

Today, she has the intention to borrow a loan from Kiva's partner, Vitas s.a.l, to buy a wax machine and additional beauty products, such as lipsticks, powder and eye shadow. This will be her second loan, and it will help her boost her earnings and, therefore, improve her family’s way of living. One of Layale’s greatest dreams is to better develop her business and gain the biggest number of clients she can.

loans.use: to buy a wax machine and additional beauty products, such as lipsticks, powder and eye shadow

loans.name: Rufina

texts.en:
Rufina earns a living through her bamboo selling business. She is a married woman and a mother of ten children. Rufina has been engaged in the business for more than 3 years now. Bamboo is used in some household renovation and also as firewood.

Rufina is asking for a loan to buy more bamboo. In the future, Rufina dreams of making her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more bamboo.

loans.name: Kamkata Group

texts.en:
Esau is pictured on the right with his hand raised amongst his Kamkata Group members. The 13 of them, 9 women and 4 men, are farmers in Chwele District. Farming inputs will be delivered to him on credit consisting of the necessary materials to plant ½ acre of millet, sweet potatoes and sorghum. Esau first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2010 Long Rains and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. Esau joined One Acre Fund in order to improve his farming techniques with One Acre Fund methods and access the best input prices.

Esau reports that before One Acre Fund, he was able to grow about 2.5 bags of maize per ½ acre, but with his One Acre Fund input loan during Long Rains 2012, he harvested 9.5 bags per ½ acre! He hopes that his profits from the 2013 Long Rains season can be used to send his children to school and repair his home. During the 2013 Long Rains season, each group member will receive ½ an acre of agricultural inputs on credit. Esau‘s group will receive 6.5 acres worth of inputs on credit.

The field officer is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of millet, sweet potatoes, and sorghum.

loans.name: Bienjelesia Group

texts.en:
John is pictured on the right with his hand raised amongst his Bienjelesia Group members. The 11 of them, 5 women and 6 men, are farmers in Chwele District. Farming inputs will be delivered to him on credit consisting of the necessary materials to plant ½ acre of millet, sweet potatoes and sorghum. John joined One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2009, and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2013 season. John joined One Acre Fund so that he could access the best input prices and use increased profits to send his children to school.

Prior to joining One Acre Fund, John was only able to harvest 3 bags of maize per ½ acre, but after joining One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2012, he was able to harvest 8 bags per ½ acre! He plans on using future profits from the harvest to send his children to school and save for the future. John’s group members will each receive input loans of ½ acre during the 2013 Long Rains season. In total they will receive inputs for 5.5 acres of millet, sweet potatoes and sorghum.

The field officer is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of millet, sweet potatoes, and sorghum.

loans.name: Munkhbat

texts.en:
Borrower Munkhbat is a married 32-year-old man who lives in outer ger district which lacks basic infrastructure of the Ulaanbaatar city of Mongolia. He lives with his wife and two sons. Both of them attend secondary school. 

He had worked as a serviceman and decided to start his own business with his spouse. He started his clothing stall business at one of the largest indoor markets located in outer ger district last March. Now he has about 4 million Mongolian tögrög (MNT) in working capital. 

He really wants to increase his working capital and improve his business since his business income is the only income in his family. He is requesting a 3.000.000 MNT loan to purchase more clothes to sell in his small stall ad increase his working capital.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell and increase his working capital

loans.name: Mounira

texts.en: Mounira is a 54 year old married woman from Lebanon. She is living with her husband and five children. Two are studying and the others started to work.  In 1997, in order to supplement the family’s income, she decided to start her own work as a farmer. Her job consists of cultivating tobacco, in addition to fruits and vegetables. Her husband who works in the construction field represents the main income source of the family. Today, she is asking to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to purchase the needed quantity of seeds and fertilizers. She states that the loan will certainly help her increase her business productivity by a large percentage which will return on her with higher profits. In the future, she plans to open a fruits and vegetables shop so she can start selling her own harvested goods.

loans.use: to purchase the needed quantity of seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en: Hadija, 29 years old, is married and has two children who are going to school. She owns a house which has electricity and piped water. Currently she has a barber shop and at the same time she does farming to earn a living. She is intending to expand her business and by doing so she needs financial support to buy another hair cutting machine, spirit and chair, and also to repair the broken machine. That is why she is requesting a loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to enable her to run her business well.

loans.use: to buy another hair cutting machine,spirit and chair, and also repair a broken machine

loans.name: Matendo Group

texts.en:
Matendo is a group of 10 farmers in Chwele District represented by Agnes. The group has nine women and one man. Agnes is on the right of the photo with her hand raised. Farming inputs will be delivered to her on credit consisting of the necessary materials to plant ½ acre of sweet potatoes, millet and sorghum. Agnes joined One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2012 and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2013 season. Agnes joined One Acre Fund so that she could access the best input prices and grow enough food for the family.

Prior to joining One Acre Fund, Agnes was only able to harvest 3.5 bags of maize per ½ acre, but after joining One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2012, she was able to harvest nine bags per ½ acre! She plans to use the money that she earns from her next harvest to buy a cow and send her children to school. Agnes' group members will each receive input loans of ½ acre during the 2013 Long Rains season. In total, they will receive inputs for five acres of maize and sorghum.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of sweet potatoes, millet and sorghum.

loans.name: Kimalewa Group

texts.en:
Kimalewa Group is located in Chwele District. It is a group of two women and eight men led by John pictured on the right with his hand raised. He is receiving an input loan for half an acre of sweet potato, millet and sorghum cultivation. John first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2010 Long Rains season and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. John joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough food for the family and to use the increased profits to send his children to school.

John described his harvest as good last year, but believes he can have an even better one this year. He hopes that his profits from the 2013 Long Rains season can be used to send his children to school and buy cattle. For the 2013 Long Rains season, John’s group members will take input loans of half an acre each. In total, this group will receive input loans for use on 5 acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of sweet potato, millet and sorghum.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for the maintenance of the motorcycle unit, tools and electricity.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more items to sell (goods, snacks and drinks).

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi lives in Msambweni, Kenya. She is 24 years old. She is a single mother of one child who attends school. 

Naomi, in order to obtain her own income more than five years ago, began her own small store in her home. She sells all types of products such as rice, sugar, oils, detergents, vegetables and fruits. She works every day from 6:00 AM until 8:00 PM, and sometimes later. 

This loan is to be used to supply her store. She is going to buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents, sausages and other staples. 

Her goals are to get ahead in business and for her business to grow more each day.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents, sausages and other staples.

loans.name: Tema Group

texts.en:
Robert is a member of a group that has 11 farmers, and is located in Teso District. Robert is pictured on the right of Tema Group, with his hand raised. He is pictured amongst the 8 men and 3 women of his group. 

Robert will receive input loans capable of planting half an acre with sorghum, sweet potatoes and millet. The 2013 Long Rains season will be Robert’s first season with One Acre Fund. He joined this year in order to gain access to hybrid seeds and fertilizer and to grow enough food for the family.

Robert described his harvest last year as good. As a One Acre Fund farmer, he hopes that he is able to join the ranks of the One Acre Fund farmers who have doubled their harvest in their first year of the program. He plans on using future profits from the harvest to send his children to school and save for the future. 

During the 2013 Long Rains season, each group member will receive half an acre of agricultural inputs on credit. Robert’s group will receive 5.5 acres worth of inputs on credit.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of millet, sweet potatoes, and sorghum.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of her motorcycle (gasoline, tune up, repairs, motor parts and oil change).

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is thankful that with her business, she is able to contribute to the well-being of her home.

She is requesting another loan of KES 40,000 in order to be able to buy larger amounts of sugar, wheat, maize flour, baked products, salt and household utensils to add her stock. 

This way, she hopes to see her kiosk grow, and to help her boost her standard of living. She appreciates your help very much.

loans.use: to buy larger amounts of sugar, wheat, maize flour, baked products, salt and household utensils to add her stock.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 53 year old, and is a divorced mother with five children, all of whom are grown-up. 

Lydia is requesting a loan to invest in her business, in which she sells fruis and vegetables. She has a stall at a market in Msambweni, and works there every day from 8am to 5pm, or until she has sold all her products. She gets her stock from the wholesale market, where she buys what she needs to sell each day. She has had this business for more than five years and it allows her to get by.

This new loan is to buy pulses, fruit and vegetables. This is Lydia's fourth cycle with Yehu Microfinance and she likes it because of the help she gets with the loans.

loans.use: to buy pulses, fruit and vegetables to sell at her market stall.

loans.name: Akitabataba Group

texts.en:
Simiyu is pictured on the right with his hand raised, amongst his Akitabataba Group members. The 24 of them, 12 women and 12 men, are farmers in Teso District. 

Farming inputs will be delivered to Simiyu on credit, consisting of the necessary materials to plant half an acre of millet, sweet potatoes and sorghum. Simiyu is a new One Acre Fund farmer and is excited for the 2013 Long Rains season. He joined One Acre Fund in order to be assured of reliable input delivery and to grow enough food for the family.

Simiyu described his harvest last year as good. As a One Acre Fund farmer, he hopes that he is able to join the ranks of One Acre Fund farmers that have doubled their harvest in their first year of the program. He hopes that his profits from the 2013 Long Rains season can be used to send his children to school and to improve his living standards. 

During the 2013 Long Rains season, each group member will receive half an an acre of agricultural inputs on credit. Simiyu‘s group will receive 12 acres worth of inputs on credit.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of millet, sweet potatoes, and sorghum.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her sari-sari, such as canned goods, snacks and drinks.

loans.name: Natalia

texts.en:
Natalia is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $500. 

Natalia is taking a loan of $1,000 to improve her business. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store, such as sleepers, cigarettes, soft drinks (Coca-Cola, Sprite, Sagiko and Fanta) and biscuits. 

Natalia is a hardworking woman, and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy cigarettes, soft drinks (Coca-Cola, Sprite, Sagiko and Fanta) and biscuits.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim is a 23-year-old young man who lives in Taiz, Yemen. He works very hard and is completing his studies with great effort and dedication. He is employed at a sponge factory with a low salary to assist his father with the household expenses. He said that without sacrifice, there is no reward and if one wants to get ahead, you have to do what you can. He applied for a youth loan of 100,000 YER from AMB to buy home appliance such as a washing machine and refrigerator to use at home. With this loan, he hopes to live in comfort.

loans.use: to buy appliances such as a washing machine and refrigerator to use at home

loans.name: Maniafu Group

texts.en:
Maniafu Group is located in Chwele District.  It is a group of seven women and five men led by Alfred, pictured on the right with his hand raised. He is receiving an input loan for ½ acre of sweet potato, millet, and sorghum cultivation. Alfred first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2008 Long Rains and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season.  Alfred joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough food for the family and use the increased profits to send his children to school.

Alfred described his harvest as very good last year, but believes he can have an even better one this year. He hopes that his profits from the 2013 Long Rains season can be used to send his children to school and buy cattle. For the 2013 Long Rains season, Alfred’s group members will take input loans of ½ acre each.  In total, this group will receive input loans for use on six acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of sweet potato, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Imad

texts.en:
Imad is a 35-year-old Lebanese man. He’s married to Fatima, a beautiful young woman. They have two small children who are still attending school.  

Imad is a great man who loves his family and really cares to offer them a respectable life. He works nonstop, on his own, to be able to cover their expenses. He has been working as a carpenter since many years ago. He’s an honest man and, above all, punctual, which is what makes his customers loyal to him. 

Today, he’s asking for a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to renew his tools. This kiva loan will facilitate his business operations and allow him to start his new project properly. 

He’s doing his best to collect higher revenues and send his children to an excellent school to help them live a very comfortable life away from hard work.

loans.use: to renew his tools.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of her motorcyle unit (gasoline, change oil, tune-up , repair, and motor parts).

loans.name: Elalai Group

texts.en:
David is a member of the Elalai Group in Teso District. He is pictured with 17 One Acre Fund farmers - 7 women and 10 men. David is standing on the right with his hand raised. 

David is a new One Acre Fund farmer and is excited for the 2013 Long Rains season. He joined One Acre Fund in order to gain access to the best input prices of hybrid seed and fertilizer. He is receiving an input loan for a ½ acre of sweet potato, millet, and sorghum cultivation.

David thought his harvest last year was poor. He hopes that, as a One Acre Fund farmer, he can have an excellent harvest. He plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to send his children to school and buy cattle. 

For the 2013 Long Rains season, David’s group members will take input loans of ½ acre each. In total, this group will receive input loans for use on 8.5 acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of sweet potato, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is happy for the last Kiva loan, as it helped him to boost his business. He, again, comes to you for another loan of 30000 KES for home repair to buy iron sheets to replace the old ones in his house.

He aspires to own another business in his hometown, and also renovate his rental houses.

He gives much appreciation to your help.

loans.use: to buy iron sheets to replace the old ones in his house.

loans.name: Sirende Juakali Group

texts.en:
Sirende Juakali Group is located in Chwele District. It is a group of 7 women and 3 men led by Charles, pictured on the right in a yellow t-shirt.

Charles joined One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2011, and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2013 season. Charles joined One Acre Fund so that he could grow enough food for the family and use increased profits to send his children to school. He is receiving an input loan for ½ acre of sweet potato, millet, and sorghum cultivation. 

Charles described his harvest as excellent last year as a One Acre Fund farmer, and hopes for another good year in the 2013 Long Rains season. He hopes that his profits from the 2013 Long Rains season can be used to send his children to school and repair his home. 

For the 2013 Long Rains season, Charles’ group members will take input loans of a ½ acre each. In total, this group will receive input loans for use on 5 acres of land.

The field officer is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of sweet potato, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris is a 47-year-old foodstuffs seller (cassava, plantain, vegetables). She is married to Samuel, a 49-year-old trader. They have a child and reside in Dansoman. She joined ID Ghana on 8 January, 2013 when she was introduced by a friend.

She has been in this trade for the past six years and still doing excellent in the Dansoman community. She is hardworking and industrious.
 
This is her first loan and she needs GHS 400 to buy more goods to meet her customers' demands.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs (cassava, plantain, vegetables) to sell

loans.name: Darry Group

texts.en:
Darry is a group of 11 farmers in the Teso District represented by Benson. The group has 5 women and 6 men. Benson is on the right of the photo with his hand raised. Farming inputs will be delivered to him on credit consisting of the necessary materials to plant ½ an acre of sweet potato, millet and sorghum. Benson first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2012 Long Rains and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. Benson joined One Acre Fund in order to gain access to the best input prices of hybrid seeds and fertilizer.

Benson described his harvest as good last year, but believes he can have an even better one this year. He plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to send his children to school and buy cattle. During the 2013 Long Rains season, each group member will receive ½ an acre of agricultural inputs on credit. Benson’s group will receive 5.5 acres worth of inputs on credit.

loans.use: To purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of sweet potato, millet, and sorghum

loans.name: Ahmadboy

texts.en: Ahmadboy is a kind and trustworthy man. He lives in the country and for 10 years he has been busy with growing agricultural products such as cucumber, onion, and corn. He has a lot of experience in growing agricultural products since he has been farming since he was a child. His father was a great farmer. Now, he is managing his business alone and does it well. He has his own plot of land and likes to work there. He has been busy with animal husbandry also. Now, he wants to develop his animal husbandry business. He is married and has 4 children. Ahmadboy is the only breadwinner in the family. His lovely wife is a housewife, and she is busy with raising their children. He must work more and get enough income for providing their children with all necessary things. He wants to get a loan to buy cattle. He is asking for a loan of 3,500 Somoni. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Akuro Group

texts.en:
Akuro Group is located in Teso District. It is a group of 11 women and two men led by Pamela, who is pictured on the right with her hand raised. She is receiving an input loan for ½ acre of sweet potato, millet, and sorghum cultivation. The 2013 long rains season will be Pamela’s first season with One Acre Fund. She joined this year in order to gain access to the best input prices for hybrid seed and fertilizer.

Pamela described her harvest last year as good, but hopes she can have an even better one as a One Acre Fund farmer. She hopes that her profits from the 2013 Long Rains season can be used to send her children to school and buy cattle. For the 2013 Long Rains season, Pamela’s group members will take input loans of ½ acre each.  In total, this group will receive input loans for use on 6.5 acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of sweet potato, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Gigush

texts.en:
Gigush is 23 years old and from Ijevan. He lives with his mother and grandmother who is a teacher at local school.

Gigush studies at the Ijevan branch of Yerevan State University in the department of economy. He works hard to study well and wants to become a good economist. Unfortunately his family's income is hardly enough to covering their basic costs and it is very difficult for Gigush save money for his education.

Gigush has applied for this loan to pay for his university tuition. It is very important to him to complete his education, find a good job, and provide a better life for his mother and grandmother.

loans.use: to pay for his university tuition

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a 35-year-old non-alcoholic wine and Coca-Cola seller. She resides in the Dansoman community. Irene has been in this business for the past 15 years and is still doing very well. She is very good and discreet when it comes to her business. 

This is Irene's fourth loan and she needs GHS 1,400 to expand her business and buy more goods to sell to her customers.

loans.use: To buy more non-alcoholic wine and Coca-Cola and sell to her customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more scrap materials (empty bottles, empty cans, scrap irons, plastics, and more)

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane says that her last Kiva loan helped her to improve her business greatly. She hopes that another loan will help her to start a new hotel.

Jane is requesting another loan of KES 50,000 to buy bags of beans, maize, sugar, cooking fat, and wheat flour to boost the business she intends to open and be successful in life.

loans.use: to buy bags of beans, maize, sugar, cooking fat, and wheat flour.

loans.name: Sabagul

texts.en: Sabagul is a wonderful and active woman. She is 46 years old. She is a kind wife and lovely mother of 4 children. She wants to start a taxi business. She is a good driver. She studied a course a the ‘To Get Ahead’ women's organization and got enough skills. Her son will help with her business. She is going to start this business so that she can get enough income to improve her living conditions. She is asking for a loan of 15,000 Somoni to buy a car for her new business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy a car for her business

loans.name: Luuya Group

texts.en:
Michael is a member of Luuya Group, in Chwele District. He is one of the 10 One Acre Fund farmers, five women and five men, in this picture of Luuya Group. Michael is standing on the right, with his hand raised. He is receiving an input loan for ½ acre of sweet potato, millet, and sorghum cultivation. Michael joined One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2011, and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2013 season. Michael joined One Acre Fund, so that he could gain access to the best input prices for hybrid seed and fertilizer.

Michael described his harvest as good last year, but he believes he can have an even better one this year. He plans on using future profits from the 2013 harvest to send his children to school and to save for the future. During the 2013 Long Rains season, each group member will receive ½ an acre of agricultural inputs, on credit. Luuya Group will receive five acres' worth of inputs on credit.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of sweet potato, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Kamule Self Help Group

texts.en:
Kamule Self Help Group is located in Chwele District. It is a group of eight women and two men, led by Henry, who is pictured on the right with his hand raised. He is receiving an input loan for ½ acre of sweet potato, millet, and sorghum cultivation. Henry first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2011 Long Rains and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. Henry joined One Acre Fund, in order to grow enough food for the family and to use his increased profits to send his children to school.

Henry described his harvest as good last year, but he believes he can have an even better one this year. He hopes that his profits from the 2013 Long Rains season can be used to send his children to school and to buy cattle. For the 2013 Long Rains season, Kamule Self Help Group's members will take input loans of ½ acre each. In total, this group will receive input loans for use on five acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of sweet potato, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Namo Group

texts.en:
Centrine is a member of Namo Group in Chwele District. She is pictured with 12 One Acre Fund farmers, 10 women and two men. Centrine is standing on the right with her hand raised. She is receiving an input loan for ½ acre of sweet potato, millet, and sorghum cultivation. Centrine joined One Acre Fund during the long rains of 2012, and is now enrolling in the long rains 2013 season. Centrine joined One Acre Fund so that she could grow enough food for the family and use her increased profits to send her children to school.

Centrine described her harvest as excellent last year as a One Acre Fund farmer and she hopes for another good year in the 2013 long rains season. She plans to use the money that she earns from her next harvest to send her children to school and repair her home. For the 2013 long rains season, Centrine’s group members will take input loans for ½ acre each. In total, this group will receive input loans for use on six acres of land. 

The field officer is standing on the left side of the photo.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of sweet potato, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Gifty

texts.en:
Gifty is a 39-year-old dress seller. She resides in the Dansoman community. She is married to Isaac, a 40-year-old trader. She is blessed with a child, who is in senior high school. Gifty has been in the dress selling business for the past five years and is still doing very well. She is very good and discreet, when it comes to her business. 

This is her first loan, and she needs the amount of GHS 400. She will use the loan to expand her business, by buying more goods to sell to her customers.

loans.use: To buy more ladies' dresses to sell to her customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for the maintenance of swine raising (feed, vaccines, supplements)

loans.name: Tumaini Khasolo Group

texts.en:
Tumaini Khasolo is a group of farmers in Chwele District represented by Moses. The group has eight women and two men. Moses is on the right of the photo with his hand raised. Farming inputs will be delivered to him on credit consisting of the necessary materials to plant ½ acre of sweet potato, millet and sorghum. Moses joined One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2011 and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2013 season. Moses joined One Acre Fund so that he could grow enough food for the family and use the increased profits to send his children to school.

Moses described his harvest as excellent last year as a One Acre Fund farmer and hopes for another good year in the 2013 Long Rains season. He hopes that his profits from the 2013 Long Rains season can be used to send his children to school and save for the future. During the 2013 Long Rains season, each group member will receive ½ acre of agricultural inputs on credit. Moses’ group will receive five acres worth of inputs on credit.

The field officer is standing at the left of the photo.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of sweet potato, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Salima

texts.en: Salima is a hard working woman. She is widow and has no children. She has no one who can help and provide her with necessary things. She wants to organize her own business to provide her own source of income. She studied the course ‘To Get Ahead’ of women organization and received a certificate. She plans to organize a new business selling food items. She is asking for a loan of $3,000 USD to buy food items for starting a new business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy food items for organizing new business

loans.name: Mbanacho Group

texts.en:
Zainab is pictured on the right with her hand raised amongst her Mbanacho Group members. The 10 of them, nine women and one man, are farmers in Chwele District. Farming inputs will be delivered to Zainab on credit and will include the necessary materials to plant ½ acre of sweet potato, millet, and sorghum. Zainab joined One Acre Fund during the long rains of 2009, and she is now enrolling for the long rains 2013 season. Zainab joined One Acre Fund so that she could gain access to hybrid seed and fertilizer and grow enough food for her family.

Zainab described her harvest as very good last year, but she believes she can have an even better harvest this year. She plans to use the money that she earns from her next harvest to send her children to school and buy cattle. During the 2013 long rains season, each group member will receive ½ an acre of agricultural inputs on credit. Zainab’s group will receive five acres worth of inputs on credit.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of sweet potato, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Nina

texts.en:
Nina is from Gosh village in the Tavush region. Together with her husband, Nina is involved in cattle breeding and sustains her children - two daughters and two sons. Nina's elder son serves in the army and her elder daughter, Melanya, studies at Dilijan State Medical College. Nina and her husband work hard to sustain the family and cover their basic needs. But it is very difficult for them to save money for Melanya's education.

Nina has applied for this loan to pay for Melanya's university tuition. It is very important for the whole family to give Melanya an opportunity to complete her education and become a good specialist.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's university tuition

loans.name: Weyeta Group

texts.en:
Weyeta Group has 14 farmers, five men and nine women, and is located in Chwele District. Alice, the representative member, is on the right side of the picture, with her hand raised. She will receive input loans capable of planting ½ acre of land with sorghum, millet, and sweet potato. Alice is a new One Acre Fund farmer and is excited for the 2013 Long Rains season. She joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough food for the family, and to use her increased profits to send her children to school.

Alice managed to harvest four bags of maize on one-half acre of land last year. As a One Acre Fund farmer, she hopes to harvest even more! She plans on using future profits from the 2013 Long Rains harvest to send her children to school and buy cattle. For the 2013 Long Rains season, Weyeta Group members will take input loans of ½ acre, each. In total, this group will receive input loans for use on seven acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of Sweet Potato, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more items to sell such as snacks and drinks.

loans.name: Sitabicha Group

texts.en:
Eunice’s group has seven farmers and is located in Chwele District. Eunice is pictured on the right of Sitabicha Group with her hand raised. She is pictured amongst the two men and five women of her group. She will receive input loans to plant ½ an acre with sorghum, millet, and sweet potato. Eunice joined One Acre Fund during the long rains of 2011, and she is now enrolling in the long rains 2013 season. She joined One Acre Fund so that she could grow enough food for her family and use the increased profits to send her children to school.

Eunice described her harvest as good last year, but believes she can have an even better one this year. She plans to use the money that she earns from her next harvest to send her children to school and repair her home. During the 2013 long rains season, each group member will receive ½ an acre of agricultural inputs on credit. Eunice’s group will receive 3.5 acres worth of inputs on credit.

The field officer is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of sweet potato, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Mwangaza Group

texts.en:
Mwangaza is a group of nine farmers in Chwele District, represented by Judith. The group has five women and four men.  Judith is on the right side of the photo, with her hand raised. Farming inputs will be delivered to her on credit, consisting of the necessary materials to plant ½ acre of sweet potato, millet and sorghum. Judith first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2011 Long Rains and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. Judith joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough food for the family, and to use her increased profits to send her children to school.

Judith described her harvest as very good last year, but she believes she can have an even better one this year. She plans to use the money that she earns from her next harvest to send her children to school and to save for the future. For the 2013 Long Rains season, Mwangaza Group members will take input loans of ½ acre, each. In total, this group will receive input loans for use on 4.5 acres of land. 

(The field officer is standing on the left side of the photo.)

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of sweet potato, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as canned goods, snacks and drinks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for the maintenance of her motorcycle (including gasoline, oil changes, tune ups, repairs, motor parts)

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.en:
Muhabbat is 47 years old. She is married and has four children. She always wanted to provide them with a good education. Since her husband’s income is not enough to provide the family with a good quality of life, Muhabbat decided to start a new business. She will work in animal husbandry, in order to generate an income with which she can contribute to her home’s finances.

She studied at the course, 'To Get Ahead,' of a women's organization, and got enough skills for doing business.  Her children will help her with the business. She will be a very successful businesswoman, because she is hard-working and smart. She is asking for a loan of 500 Somoni to buy cattle, for starting her new business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy cattle for organizing a new business

loans.name: Asif

texts.en: Asif has been an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from Fuzuli city. Now he lives in Fuzuli region, which is close to the occupied border. Asif is 40 years old, married and has two children, an 11-year-old daughter and a 5-year-old son.  He wants his daughter to become a teacher of violin and his son to go into business. His daughter goes to school and his son goes to preschool. His wife stays at home, so he is the only one making an income. This is Asif's second loan from Kiva. He started his taxi-driving business 10 years ago. Now he needs a 2,000 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat) loan to repair his car because his car has broken down. He wants to use the money from his business to help his family. In the future, he wants to buy a new car because this car is old and uncomfortable for passengers. This will be more profitable for his business. He is thankful to Komak and Kiva for supporting him again.

loans.use: to repair his car

loans.name: Nangwe East Group

texts.en:
Nangwe East Group is comprised of 16 farmers in Chwele District, represented by Protus. The group has 13 women and 3 men.  Protus is on the right of the photo, with his hand raised. Farming inputs will be delivered to him on credit, consisting of sufficient materials to plant ½ acre of sweet potato, millet and sorghum. Protus joined One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2011, and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2013 season. Protus joined One Acre Fund so that he could gain access to the best input prices for hybrid seed and fertilizer.

Protus described his harvest as good last year, but he believes he can have an even better one this year. He hopes that his profits from the 2013 Long Rains season can be used to send his children to school and to save for the future. During the 2013 Long Rains season, each group member will receive ½ an acre of agricultural inputs, on credit. In total, Nangwe East Group will receive 8 acres' worth of inputs on credit.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of sweet potato, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Nangwe Central Group

texts.en:
Rodgers is a member of Nangwe Central Group in Chwele District. He is pictured with 13 One Acre Fund farmers, 12 women and 1 man. Rodgers is standing on the right with his hand raised. He is receiving an input loan for ½ acre of sweet potato, millet, and sorghum cultivation. Rodgers first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2012 Long Rains and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. Rodgers joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough food for the family and use the increased profits to send his children to school.

Rodgers described his harvest as good last year, but believes he can have an even better one this year. He plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to send his children to school and save for the future. For the 2013 Long Rains season, Rodgers’ group members will take input loans of ½ acre each. In total, this group will receive input loans for use on 6.5 acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of sweet potato, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more items to sell (canned goods, snacks, drinks)

loans.name: Maua Group

texts.en:
Maua Group is comprised of 12 farmers, 10 women and 2 men, in Chwele District. The group is represented by Scolastic, the lady on the right side of the photo, with her hand raised. Farming inputs will be delivered to her on credit, consisting of sufficient materials to plant ½ acre of sweet potato, millet, and sorghum. Scolastic is a new One Acre Fund farmer and is excited for the 2013 Long Rains season. She joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough food for the family, and to use her increased profits to send her children to school.

Scolastic described her harvest last year as good, but she hopes she can have an even better one this year, as a One Acre Fund farmer. She plans to use the money that she earns from her next harvest to send her children to school and to save for the future. During the 2013 Long Rains season, each group member will receive ½ an acre of agricultural inputs on credit. In total, Maua Group will receive six acres' worth of inputs, on credit.

(The field officer is standing on the left of the photo.)

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of sweet potato, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Haitgul

texts.en: Haitgul is 50 years old. She is married and has three children. She lives in the country and her living place is perfect for animal husbandry. She has a good idea to start a new business in animal husbandry. She must find her own source of income as her husband has a small salary and it is not enough to provide the family with all the necessary things. She studied the course ‘To Get Ahead’ from a women's organization and got a certificate. She is asking for a loan of 2,000 Somoni to buy cattle to organize a new business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy cattle to start a new business

loans.name: Haitham

texts.en:
Haitham is a married man, 25 years old, who doesn't have children. He is a hard worker, and he lives with his parents in Hodeida, Yemen. He has operated a motorbike transportation service as his main source of income, earning enough to cover his daily expenses. He would like to increase his services to customers and increase his profits, so he is taking out a youth loan of 100,000 YER from AMB. He will use the loan to buy another motorbike.

He wants to expand his business, in the future. He hopes to own a taxi, to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a new motorbike to use for his transportation business

loans.name: Davaa

texts.en:
Mr. Davaa is 50 years old. He lives with his wife and three sons, in Ulaangom soum, Uvs province, in western Mongolia. His wife Tseren, age 48, helps her husband to run their animal pelt and raw materials business. His sons Otgonbold, age 22, and Erbold, age 26, work at construction sites as assistant workers, and his son Batbold, age 16, goes to a local secondary school.

Borrower and his wife have been running their business of selling animal pelts and raw materials, since 2006. Davaa purchases animal pelts and hides from herders in the countryside and brings them to the city to sell.  He needs to borrow 6,000,000 MNT, which he will use to purchase an eco-friendly vehicle for the business. The eco-friendly vehicle will reduce their transportation expense, and thereby increase their effectiveness. Davaa is a hard-working, modest and responsible man.

loans.use: to purchase an eco-friendly vehicle for the animal pelt business, which will reduce the transportation costs

loans.name: Hanady

texts.en:
Hanady is a 31-year-old, married woman, and the mother of two children. She has been working in selling beauty cosmetics since 2010. Her business is going on just fine, but it needs some external financing, to improve it more and reply to customers' needs.

Hanady is applying for a loan from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua, in order to increase her business merchandise by adding a special, just-released spring and summer collection. This loan will develop her business more and help her to increase her business capital. It will also increase product diversity, which will attract customers' attention and increase her income.

Hanady is well-known in the region, with her good reputation and the good quality of the products she offers. She hopes to keep on expanding her business, to attract more customers in the future.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise by adding a special, just-released spring and summer collection

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more items to resell in her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more items to resell in her store

loans.name: Mutindi

texts.en:
Mutindi would like credit, to finance her business of selling fruits and vegetables. She has a market stall, to which she goes day after day, to sell her produce. 

She will invest this credit in more fruits and vegetables to sell, and in that way she will be able to continue selling produce. She has been with Yehu Microfinance for years, and she likes it because of the help that they have always offered with credit.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to resell at her market stall

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Celina Jakuru

texts.en: Celina is a married mother of two and a small hotel manager who has benefited from her previous loans with Finance Sudan and Kiva. She has increased her working capital, paid part of her children's school fees, and is now taking another loan to buy more meat, rice and many others goods. She is happy and appreciative for the support Finance Sudan  and Kiva are giving her.

loans.use: to buy goods such as meat, rice, and beans for her hotel business

loans.name: Nangwe West Group

texts.en:
Janerose is pictured on the right side of the Nangwe West Group members with her hand raised. The 14 of them, 11 women and three men, are farmers in Chwele District. Enough farming supplies to plant a half-acre of sweet potatoes, millet, and sorghum will be delivered to Janerose on credit. Janerose joined One Acre Fund during the long rains 2010, and is now enrolling for the long rains 2013 season. She joined One Acre Fund to get the best prices for hybrid seed and fertilizer.

Janerose described her harvest as good last year, but believes she can have an even better one this year. She plans to use the money that she earns from her next harvest to send her children to school and save for the future. For the 2013 long rains season, Janerose’s group members will take loans for a half-acre each. In total, this group will receive loans for seven acres of land.

loans.use: to buy hybrid seed and fertilizer to cultivate sweet potatoes, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay the expenses of swine raising (feed, vaccines, and supplements).

loans.name: Myagmarjav

texts.en: Myagmarjav is 27 years old. He lives with his wife and three daughters in Ger in Uvs Province, Mongolia. His wife, Gerelmaa, stays home and takes care of their newborn baby daughter Badamhatan, age 1. His daughter Altantuya, age 6, goes to the local primary school, and Saruul goes to kindergarten. The borrower is partially disabled, and his wife needs to work in order to cover their family expenses. His wife has been working as tailor in a private company for years. She is now starting her own tailoring business at home and is requesting a loan of MNT 600,000 to buy inventory to start this business. Both the borrower and his wife are hardworking, diligent, and responsible.

loans.use: to buy inventory for his wife's tailoring business at home

loans.name: Jenga Ujengewe Group

texts.en:
Phanice is a member of Jenga Ujengewe Group in Chwele District. She is pictured with 11 One Acre Fund farmers, eight women and three men. Phanice is standing on the right with her hand raised. She is receiving an input loan for half an acre of sweet potatoes, millet and sorghum cultivation. Phanice joined One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2010 season, and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2013 season. Phanice joined One Acre Fund so that she could receive inputs on time and grow enough food for the family.

Prior to joining One Acre Fund, Phanice was only able to harvest five bags of maize per half acre, but after joining One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2012 season, she was able to harvest 22 bags per half acre! She plans on using future profits from the harvest to send her children to school and buy a cow. 

Phanice’s group members will each receive input loans of half an acre during the 2013 Long Rains season. In total, they will receive inputs for 5.5 acres of millet, sweet potatoes and sorghum.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of millet, sorghum and sweet potatoes.

loans.name: Davud

texts.en:
Davud is 55 years old, married and has four children, a 23-year-old and 22-year-old daughter and a 20-year-old and 19-year-old son. His daughters are married and his sons go to college. Davud wants his sons to go into the products selling business, too. His wife stays at home, so he is the only one making an income. 

Davud has been an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from Fuzuli city. Now he lives in the Fuzuli region, which is close to the occupied border. This is Davud's second loan from Kiva. He started his business five years ago to sell food products in a store. Now he needs a 2,000 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat) loan to buy sausages, eggs, butter, flour and etc. He wants to use the money from his new stock to help his family. In the future, he wants to repair and extend the store. This will be more profitable for his business. Davud is thankful to Komak and Kiva for supporting him.

loans.use: to buy products like sausages, eggs, butter, flour, etc.

loans.name: Maendeleo Farmers Group

texts.en:
Maendeleo Farmers Group is located in Kakamega North District. It is a group of 12 women and eight men led by Patrick, who is pictured on the right with his hand raised. He is receiving an input loan for half an acre of sweet potato, millet and sorghum cultivation. Patrick is a new One Acre Fund farmer and is excited for the 2013 Long Rains season. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access the best input prices and grow enough food for the family.

Patrick managed to harvest five bags of maize on 2 acres of land last year. As a One Acre Fund farmer, he hopes to harvest even more! He plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to repair his home and perhaps invest in another business. For the 2013 Long Rains season, Patrick’s group members will take input loans of ½ acre each. In total, this group will receive input loans for use on 10 acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of millet, sorghum and sweet potatoes.

loans.name: Farhod

texts.ru: Фарход с детства любил полицейскую форму и мечтал стать защитником своей родины. После окончания средний школы он поступил в Полицейскую школу и окончил с отличием. Благодаря, его развитому уму и интеллекту, его карьера развивается быстро.  Он работает в Отделе Внутренних Дел. Он любит свою профессию. Фарход является хорошим семьянином тоже. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Его квартира имеет плохое состояние, и он должен срочно отремонтировать свою квартиру. Его зарплата не хватает для проведения ремонта. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 2000 долларов США для покупки краски, обои, цемент и другие строительные материалы. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: From his early childhood, Farhod loved the police uniform and dreamed of becoming a protector of his country. After finishing high school, he entered the Police Academy and graduated with honours. Thanks to his intelligence and quick wit, his career has progressed rapidly. He works in the Department of Internal Affairs. He loves his profession, and he is also a good family man. He is married with 2 children. However, his apartment is in poor condition, and he needs to renovate immediately. His salary is not sufficient for him to be able to carry out these home repairs, so Farhod is seeking a loan of 2,000 US dollars to purchase paint, wallpaper, cement, and other construction materials. He is waiting for your kindness.

loans.use: To buy paint, cement, and wall-paper to carry out home repairs

loans.name: Nazira

texts.ru: Назира очень благодарна всем тем кто поддержал Назиру. Доходы от первого кредита позволили улучшить благосостояние семьи очень хорошо. В этот раз Назира обращается к фонду Кива за кредитом в размере 100,000 KGS на приобретение дойных коров.Доходы от кредита намерена направит на на ремонт дома.
texts.en: Nazira is very grateful to all those who supported her previous loan, the income from which allowed her to significantly improve the welfare of her family. This time Nazira has approached Kiva for a loan of 100,000 Kyrgyzstan Som (KGS) to purchase dairy cows. She intends to use the profit she makes to renovate her home.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Shahlo

texts.ru: Шахло 27 лет. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 1 ребенка. Его муж инженер, а сын ходит в детский сад. Шахло является заместителем директора в частной организации и выполняет свою работу отлично. У Шахло очень дружная семья. Его родители пенсионеры и получают маленькую пенсию. Ее сестра планирует выйти замуж за любимого человека, однако родители не имеют сбережения для проведения свадьбы и для приданного. Родители Шахло надеяться только на Шахло. Шахло тоже не имеет сбережения, чтобы помочь родителям и осуществить мечту любимой сестры. Она запрашивает займ в сумме 1500 долларов США для проведения свадебного мероприятия. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Shahlo is 27 years old, married, and has 1 child. Her husband is an engineer and her son goes to kindergarten. She is a deputy director in a private organisation and is an excellent employee. She is very close to her family. Her parents are retired and have a small pension. Her sister is planning to marry her sweetheart. However, Shahlo's parents do not have enough savings to cover the cost of hosting a wedding and for a dowry, and their hopes are on Shahlo. She does not have enough savings to help her beloved sister realise her dream, either. She is seeking a loan of 1,500 US dollars to host the wedding reception. She is waiting for your kindness.

loans.use: To host the wedding of her beloved sister

loans.name: Wendyam Group

texts.fr:
Mme SAFIATA représente le groupe WENDYAM. Elle se porte bien. Mariée, elle est  mère de 02 enfants. Le plus âgé a 08ans et le moins âgé a 05ans. 01 va à l’école et elle a 03 personnes en charge.Sur la photo,SAFIATA n'a pas apporté ses marchandises,elle tient le cartable de leur document de crédit.
Elle vend des pagnes traditionnels et du savon liquide depuis 03ans. Mme s’approvisionne au marché de Gounghin. Ses clients  sont les femmes.
Mme veut s’acheter  10 pagnes et 20bidons de savon liquide.
Elle veut épargner ses bénéfices pour avoir un hangar pour son activité. Elle ambitionne toujours agrandir  son champ d’activité et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. Safiata represents the Wendyam group. She is doing well. Married, she is the mother of two children. The eldest is eight and the youngest is five years old. One child goes to school and she has three other people to care for.

In the photo Safiata did not bring her goods, She is holding the binder containing the loan documents.

She has been selling traditional pagnes (colorful West-African fabric) and liquid soap for the past three years. She resupplies at the Gounghin market and her clients are women. She wants to buy 10 pagnes and 20 cans of liquid soap.

She would like to save her earnings so she can obtain a shed for her business activity. She always aims to expand the scope of her activities and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: buy 10 pagnes and 20 cans of liquid soap.

loans.name: Luz Mercedes

texts.es:
Luz Mercedes es un claro ejemplo de la valentía de miles de mujeres que a pesar de sufrir el abandono de sus cónyuges, su esperanza nunca se apaga y la ilusión de ver crecer a sus hijos las impulsa a salir adelante. 
Sin educación pero llena de razones para luchar por un mejor mañana, esta mujer de 49 años de edad, se prepara cada día para enfrentarse al duro mundo de la calle, en donde comercializa tinto y panes a los transeúntes. De esta manera Luz, consigue el dinero para darle de comer a su familia.
Sueña con un mejor futuro en donde pueda tener una vivienda propia y los recursos necesarios para brindarles a sus cuatro hijos educación.
Hoy se encuentra en búsqueda de un crédito con el fin de comprar una greca con mayor capacidad de almacenamiento y surtido (panes, café, azucar), con el propósito de aumentar sus ventas, mejorando su condición económica y la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Luz Mercedes is a clear example of many women's courage in spite of a husband's abandonment. Her hope never disappears and her dream to see her children grow drive her to succeed in life.
Without having an education but full of reasons to thrive for a better tomorrow, this 49 year old woman prepares herself everyday to confront the harsh life in the streets where she sells red wine and bread to pedestrians. Through this business Luz is able to feed her family. She dreams of a better future where she can have her own home and the resources needed to offer her 4 children an education.
Today she is requesting a loan to buy a larger food cart for more storage and buy more merchandise (bread, coffee, sugar), to increase sales, improve her financial stability and family's life quality.

loans.use: buy a larger food cart for more storage and buy more merchandise (bread, coffee, sugar)

loans.name: Maria Celsa

texts.es:
María Celsa, es una mujer que se ha caracterizado por sus ganas de salir adelante y ofrecerles a sus diez hijos una mejor calidad de vida. Siempre ha laborado como independiente con el fin de poder cuidar de sus hijos y generar los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de su hogar.
En la actualidad se dedica a la venta de frutas y jugos en un paradero de buses, Su mayor deseo es ampliar su negocio y aumentar su número de clientes, y para ello se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en adecuaciones locativas y la compra de surtido (frutas). Espera que con esta inversión sus ingresos mejoren y pueda garantizarles a sus hijos mejores condiciones de vida y acceso a la educación superior.
texts.en: María Celsa is a woman who describes herself with having a drive to succeed and offer her 10 children a better quality of life. She has always worked independently to provide for her children and have an income to cover living costs. At the moment she sells fruits and juices at bus stops. Her biggest dream is to grow her business and increase sales which is why she is requesting a loan to make improvements for her food cart and buy more fruits. She hopes that with this investment her profits will increase and she can guarantee her children a better quality of life and access to a higher education.

loans.use: make improvements for her food cart and buy more fruits

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
Luz Marina de 56 años de edad, es una mujer a la que le ha tocado rebuscarse la vida para brindarle educación a su hijo de 18 años de edad. Su esposo nunca ha podido tener un trabajo estable debido al bajo nivel educativo que posee, por lo cual, gran cantidad de las responsabilidades del hogar recaen sobre ella.
Con el fin de poder cuidar de su hijo y generar  ingresos, Luz Marina decidió montar en su vivienda una miscelánea en la que labora diariamente prestando servicios de fotocopias, venta de mecatos y helado. Gracias a esta actividad ha podido solventar las necesidades y mejorar su calidad de vida. En la actualidad se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de surtido para aumentar sus ventas y garantizarle a su hijo educación.
Su mayor deseo es poder tener una estabilidad económica para olvidarse de las preocupaciones diarias.
texts.en:
Luz Marina is 56 years old woman who had to reinvent herself to offer her 18 years old son an education. Her husband has not been able to maintain a stable job since he did not get very far in his education. A large amount of housework is her responsibility. 
To be able to take care of her son and make a living, Luz Marina decided to open up a shop where she offers photocopy service and sells pastries and ice cream. Thanks to this business she has been able to provide for daily necessities and improve the quality of her life.  At the moment, she is requesting a loan to stock up her merchandise to increase sales and guarantee her son an education. Her biggest wish is to have financial stability to forget about everyday worries.

loans.use: buy pastries, ice cream, and office supplies.

loans.name: Mamlakatkhon

texts.ru: Мамлакатхан благодарит всех кто поддержал Мамлакатхан. Доходы от первого кредита позволили улучшить благосостояние семьи очень хорошо и реализовать свои планы по увеличению хозяйства. В этот раз Мамлакат обращается к фонду Кива и к Банку Бай Тушум и Партнеры за кредитом в размере 130,000 KGS на приобретение скота, для увеличения доходов от перепродажи. В этом году Мамлакатхан планирует поехать в Хадж.
texts.en: Mamlakatkhon is grateful to those who supported her previous loan, the income from which allowed her to significantly improve her family's welfare and also to realise her plans to expand her farm. Now she has approached Kiva and Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 130,000 Kyrgyzstan Som (KGS) to purchase cattle so she can increase her earnings from their re-sale. She plans to go on the Hajj this year.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: The previous Kiva loan helped Margaret to buy sewing machines for her business. Because of the business demand and needs of her customers, she is requesting another loan of 50,000 KES to buy cloth materials to expand her business as she aspires to open a dress-making college soon.

loans.use: to buy cloth materials to expand her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more snacks and spices to sell

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is a 24-year-old man. He describes himself as a hard working and caring man. He operates a motorcycle business where he provides transportation services. He has been involved in this business for 2 years. His business is located within a busy area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge as insufficient funds for improving the business. He will use the KES 40,000 loan to purchase another motorcycle to increase transportation services. His business goal is to own a taxi within 5 years. This is his third loan with SMEP DTM after managing to repay a previous loan of KES 81,000 successfully.

loans.use: to purchase another motorcycle

loans.name: Saikal

texts.ru: Сайкал 56 лет, замужем, имеет 5 взрослых детей. Сайкал в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, на протяжении многих лет занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы в 10,000 сом. Благодаря упорному труду Сайкал в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется развивающееся хозяйство, продажа молока и доходы от полеводства приносит около 9,000 сом в месяц. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Сайкал обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 1 коровы и овец в целях увеличения доходов от перепродажи скота. Доходы от кредита Сайкал будет вкладывать в дальнейшее развитие бизнеса и улучшение благосостояния семьи и внуков.
texts.en:
Saikal is a 56-year-old wife and mother of five grown children. As her family's main income-provider, she has worked in animal husbandry for many years. She began her business with an initial investment of 10,000 som. Thanks to hard work she now has a developing farm. Her milk and produce sales bring in 9,000 som a month. 

With long-term business development in mind, Saikal turned to Bai Tushum and Partners for a 70,000 som loan to purchase a cow and some sheep. Her aim is to increase her income from the resale of cattle. She plans to invest the additional income in long-term business development and the improvement of her family's material well-being.

loans.use: To purchase a cow and and sheep

loans.name: María Margarita

texts.es:
María Margarita de 54 años de edad es una mujer que ha logrado con sacrificio y dedicación montar su taller de confección a terceros en el cual labora de lunes a domingo de 7 de la mañana a 6 de la tarde. 	Comenzó su oficio desde hace veinte años y asegura que gracias a este ha podido brindarles a sus  seis hijos una educación y alimento.
En la actualidad se dedica a la confección de pijamas y sudaderas, para diferentes empresas del sector. 
Su mayor sueño es generar fuentes de empleo y aumentar su nivel de producción con el fin de mejorar no sólo su calidad de vida sino las de otras familias. Hoy se encuentra solicitando un crédito para la compra de una máquina recubridora con el fin de mejorar la calidad en el servicio e incrementar su producción.
texts.en:
María Margarita is 54 years old and, with sacrifice and dedication, she has managed to start up her own dressmaking workshop.  She works Monday to Sunday from 7am until 6pm.  She started this work twenty years ago and says that, thanks to it, she has been able to provide food and education to her six children.

María currently makes pyjamas and sweatshirts for different businesses in the area.

Her biggest dream is to generate jobs and increase production so that, in addition to improve her own living standards, she can do the same for other families.  María is currently applying for a loan to buy a coverstitch sewing machine so that she can improve the quality of service she offers and increase production.

loans.use: to buy a coverstitch sewing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy material and accessories (such as buttons and sequins).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds and fertiliser.

loans.name: Suvdmaa

texts.en: Suvdmaa, 49, lives with her husband and 2 daughters in an apartment in Orhon Province, Mongolia. Her husband Enhbat, 47, is disabled and stays home because he requires constant care. Her daughters Selenge, 20, and Solongo, 19, are university students. The borrower has been running a clothing sales business in town since 2006. She has gained a lot of experience over the years and covers all her family expenses all by herself with her business profit. She is now requesting 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase a large amount of clothing inventory to help her clothing sales business run smoothly. She is a hardworking, optimistic and responsible woman.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of clothing inventory to help her clothing sales business run smoothly.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a married woman. She has three children, ranging in age from 3 to 14 years old. She describes herself as a God-fearing woman. She operates a beauty salon, where she provides hair services. She has been engaged in this business for five years. Her business is located in a busy area, and her primary customers are from the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge as lack of capital to improve the business. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy cosmetics for the beauty salon. Her business goal is to run a bigger beauty salon within five years.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Gichuki

texts.en: Francis is a married man. He has three children. He describes himself as a hard-working man. He operates a general store, where he sells electronics and utensils. He has been engaged in this business for six years. His business is located in a busy area, and his primary customers are from the general public. He describes his biggest business challenge as stiff competition in the area. He will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy electronics and utensils. His business goal is to run a bigger general store selling electronics and utensils within five years. This is his third loan from SMEP DTM. He managed to repay his previous loan of KES 50,000 successfully.

loans.use: to buy electronics and utensils to sell in his general store.

loans.name: Heigar

texts.en: Heigar is from Israel’s Negev region. She was never given the opportunity to study in school. Through her determination and a desire to succeed in life and be economically independent, Heigar has developed into a good microenterpreneur and income-provider. Heigar has a store which sells children’s and women’s clothes, as well as tablecloths and bedding supplies. She recently moved her store and undertook renovations, in order to expand. Heigar needed this loan to assist in buying stock of women’s and children’s clothing, children’s games, bedding, linens and gift items. Heigar’s store is centrally located and provides the opportunity for mothers to buy for themselves and their children all in one location She wants to further expand and in the future provide a one-stop-shopping bazaar for the entire family.

loans.use: to buy stock of women’s and children’s clothing, children’s games, bedding, linens and gift items after the renovation of her store.

loans.name: Rahma

texts.en: Rahma is a 47-year-old married woman, the mother of two children. She has been selling beauty cosmetics and perfumes since 2009. Rahma has specialized in this business in order to help her husband in making the family’s living and covering her children's expenses. To increase her family's income and better support her husband, Rahma is applying for a loan from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua, to support her clothes-selling business, offering a newly released spring and summer clothes collection. Rahma hopes that one day she will be capable of opening her own clothes and cosmetics selling shop, and improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a new collection of spring and summer clothes to develop her business.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is 50 years old, married, and blessed with four children between 9 and 22 years old. She sells new clothing in Kapsabet and has been in operation for a period of 10 years, earning an income of KES 40,000 monthly. She has borrowed her third loan of KES 70,000, and she wishes to use this amount to buy more fashions of new clothes for men, ladies and children. The profits she earns will be used to repay the loan and to pay school fees for her children. Her dream is live happily and to prosper in business.

loans.use: to buy more new clothing to sell in her business.

loans.name: Namwoki Self Help Group

texts.en:
Sylvano’s group has 15 farmers and is located in Kakamega North District. Sylvano is pictured on the right of Namwoki Self Help Group with his hand raised. Sylvano is pictured amongst the 7 men and 8 women of his group. He will receive input loans capable of planting ½ an acre with sorghum, millet and sweet potato. The 2013 Long Rains season will be Sylvano’s first season with One Acre Fund. He joined this year in order to grow enough food for his family and to generate enough profits to send his children to school.

Sylvano managed to harvest 10 bags of maize on 2 acres of land last year. As a One Acre Fund farmer, he hopes to harvest even more! He plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to send his children to school and perhaps invest in another business. For the 2013 Long Rains season, Sylvano’s group members will take input loans of ½ acre each.  In total, this group will receive input loans for use on 7 1/2 acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of millet, sorghum and sweet potatoes.

loans.name: Tuvshinbaatar

texts.en:
Mr. Tuvshinbaatar is 35 years old and lives with his wife and 2 children in a ger (felt-lined tent) in Tosontsengel soum of Zavhan province, Mongolia. His wife, Batchimeg, works as a housekeeper in a local private company. His son, Olziitogtoh, age 6, goes to the local primary school and his daughter, Olziijargal, age 4, goes to a local kindergarten. 

Tuvshingaatar has been running a taxi service with his car since 2011. He is a well-experienced driver with a good reputation among his customers. He is now requesting 1,500,000 MNT to purchase an Eco-friendly car to provide his taxi service business in town. He is a hardworking, responsible and enthusiastic man.

loans.use: to purchase an Eco-friendly car to provide his taxi service business in town.

loans.name: Gaudencia

texts.en: Gaudencia is a 28-year-old married woman. She has 2 children, ages 2 and 6. She describes herself to be a focused woman. She operates a beauty salon where she provides hair services. She has been involved in this business for 8 years. Her business is located within an urban area and her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge to be stiff competition within the area. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to pay school fees for her children. Her business goal is to own a shopping mall selling beauty products within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Inama Group

texts.en:
Fred’s group has 12 farmers and is located in Chwele District. Fred is pictured on the right of the Inama Group with his hand raised. He is pictured among the 7 men and 5 women of his group. He will receive input loans capable of planting ½ an acre with sorghum and millet. Fred first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2012 Long Rains season and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. Fred joined One Acre Fund in order to access the best input prices and grow enough food for the family.

Fred reports that before One Acre Fund he was able to grow about 2 1/2 bags of maize per ½ acre, but with his One Acre Fund input loan during Long Rains 2012, he harvested 16 bags per 1/2 acre! He plans on using future profits from the harvest to send his children to school and save for the future. For the 2013 Long Rains season, Fred’s group members will take input loans of ½ acre each. In total, this group will receive input loans for use on 6 acres of land. 

The field officer is standing on the left of the photo with his right hand raised.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of millet and sorghum.

loans.name: Imani Farmers Group

texts.en:
Robai is a member of the Imani Farmers Group in Kakamega North District. She is pictured with 20 One Acre Fund farmers - all of them are women. Robai is standing on the right with her hand raised. She is receiving an input loan for ½ acre of sweet potatoes, millet and sorghum cultivation. Robai is a new One Acre Fund farmer and is excited for the 2013 Long Rains season. She joined One Acre Fund in order to gain access to hybrid seed and fertilizer and grow enough food for the family.

Last year, Robai harvested 4 bags of maize on 1/2 acre of land. She is excited to improve her harvest as a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. She hopes that her profits from the 2013 Long Rains season can be used to send her children to school and to buy a cow. For the 2013 Long Rains season, Robai’s group members will take input loans of ½ acre each. In total, this group will receive input loans for use on 10 acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of millet, sorghum and sweet potatoes.

loans.name: Jemima

texts.en:
Jemima is a 37-year-old door-to-door seller. She is an individual member of a group which meets on Thursdays. She is married to Francis, a 45-year-old carpenter. She resides at Mpoase in the Dansoman community.

She has been operating her business for the past 8 years. She gets her goods from the depot on large scale and in turn sells to her customers. She is very dedicated, industrious and very hardworking.

This is her 1st loan. She is requesting an amount of GHS 500 to help her buy more items to sell to her customers.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell to customers.

loans.name: Kasao

texts.en:
Kasao is 38 years old and married to Noonkipa. They both support a family of eight children. Kasao is a maize farmer and he also keeps animals. He has been in this business for the last 11 years with a monthly income of about KES 10,000.

Kasao is servicing his 5th loan of KES 50,000 from KADET, and this will facilitate him in preparing the farm and to purchase cows, goats and sheep. He hopes to use the anticipated profit to expand his farm and reinvest. His future dreams are to improve the home living standards and to educate his children.

loans.use: to pay for land cultivation.

loans.name: Mkenda Mbola Group

texts.en:
Bilha represents the all-women Mkenda Mbola group comprised of 15 farmers in the Chwele District. She is on the right of the photo with her hand raised. Farming inputs will be delivered to Bilha on credit consisting of the necessary materials to plant ½ acre of millet and sorghum. She joined One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2010, and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2013 season. Bilha joined One Acre Fund so that she could grow enough food for her family and benefit from the group work.

Bilha described her harvest as good last year, but believes she can have an even better one this year. She plans to use the money that she earns from her next harvest to send her children to school and buy land. For the 2013 Long Rains season, Mkenda Mbola group members will take input loans of ½ acre each. In total, this group will receive input loans for use on 7 1/2 acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer to cultivate millet and sorghum

loans.name: Mbanacho Group

texts.en:
Richard’s group has 11 farmers and is located in the Chwele District. He is pictured on the right of Mbanacho Group with his hand raised among the six men and five women of his group.
